story:
Featured on

 

 

What is HandEnergy?

HandEnergy is your pocket electricity generator. Everyone knows what low battery means: we are disconnected from the world! And sometimes there’s no way to charge your battery when you urgently need it. Now you can forget about this problem, as you would always have your own generator with you.

Generate your own clean energy with the power of your body; store it, always keep it with you, and charge your devices wherever you are.

Forget about your battery running out. Be independent from the electricity grid and don’t waste your time looking for a socket.

How HandEnergy works?

 

First, start HandEnergy by winding the starter ring.

 

Release the starter ring. That will transmit an impulse to the rotor.

 

Rotate your HandEnergy with your wrist to keep the rotor spinning.

 

Average speed 5000 RPM. The magnetic rotor transmits mechanical power to the stator and produce an electric current, charging the built-in batteries.

 

USB Output 5V 1A

 

What kind of devices can you charge?

 

What makes HandEnergy special?

 

Be independent

 

Always With You

 

Energy Problem Solution

 

Efficiency

 

Eco-Friendly Energy Resource

 

Exercise—Physical activity

 

Electric current

 

What people say about HandEnergy?

 

Tech Specs

 

What about speed of charging?

HandEnergy has the same current as when you charge devices from the socket. However to charge the battery of HandEnergy by rotating takes a bit longer due to lower current from generation.

 

HandEnergy Mobile App and Community

The HandEnergy app allows you to track your generation and share it with your friends. By joining the HandEnergy community, you can compete with others and see how the real dynamo machine works to reduce the use of fossil fuels.

The HandEnergy app is a great thing for mobile games developers: now we can really use our physical power while playing.

 

Styles & Design

You may choose a Hand Energy device according to your taste. Our design covers a wide colour range and includes some limited editions, too. It will be very easy to find something that matches your style.

 

HandEnergy development and the Team

We are a group of enthusiasts with a technical background. Our speciality is the production and maintenance of industrial electricity generators. Looking at these huge things, we came up with the idea to make it small so that people can use it in everyday life.

We have tested dozens of options to ascertain how a man can best transform body muscle power into electricity, while keeping in mind that it has to be small, portable and cool. The result of this is HandEnergy.

#HandEnergyTour

Before this campaign, we made a #HandEnergyTour around Europe to show our product to the people. We visited 15 cities in nine countries during two weeks, where we gave hundreds of people the HandEnergy to test, asking their feedback. Now we are sure that people truly want this device! Let us thank all of you for your ideas and support.

 

Our Timeline

 

Rewards

 

 

Why we need your help

We have been working on HandEnergy for more than a year now, and to move further we need to use professional equipment, some customised spare parts, and a variety of the best plastics and metal alloys. We need your support to get access to all these resources, to realise the production plan and to make the world energy-safer for you.

 

Our Mission

Today, we can’t imagine our lives without mobile devices and all of them need to be charged. We want to help people to be independent from the power grid, or at least to have an emergency source of energy. We are passionate about producing clean energy and HandEnergy is our contribution to that.

We believe our HandEnergy will help people in developing countries with poor electricity coverage to be closer to the internet and education by having their smartphones always on. We will work with United Nations to bring this idea to live. 

 

 

Follow us

story:
We would like to introduce you to LastTissue. It’s like if a handkerchief and a tissue pack had a baby.

We're bringing you the best of both worlds: the easy, on-the-go availability of the tissue pack and the environmentally-friendly, soft-on-the-nose handkerchief. We want to bring the handkerchief back into mainstream culture.

Simply take a tissue from the bottom, use it, and then store it on top of the marked-tissue barrier. This way, you’ll push the clean tissues down, making them ready to use and dividing them from the used. You’ll know you’re on your last tissue when the marked one appears - that means it’s cleaning time. After washing, you repack and use them all over again.

The paper and pulp industry is the third-largest industrial emitter of global warming gasses. Every year around 8,000,000 trees are cut down to make facial tissues for the US alone. 

Deforestation can lead to a direct loss of wildlife habitat.  The removal of trees reduces available food, shelter, and breeding habitat. It also removes the miraculous effect the trees have of cleaning our carbon emissions to breathable oxygen - helping to prevent climate change.  

Every time you blow your nose with a LastTissue, you save 2 liters of water.

⚡It takes 3 times more energy to produce paper tissues compared to the reusable cotton tissues.

With one LastTissue pack, you will save the planet from more than 2800 single-use tissues as well as their plastic packaging.

Every day 22,000 trees are cut down just to supply facial tissues for The US. Imagine how many trees are cut down worldwide. This is simply unnecessary. Reusability can make a huge difference.  

   

Raccoon Blue. The pygmy raccoon, is a critically endangered species off the coast of Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico.

Dragonfly Turquoise. 163 Mediterranean dragonflies and damselflies show that five species are critically endangered.

Fox Peach. Darwin’s fox originally found in southern temperate rain forests is considered to have the highest extinction risk of any Chilean mammals.

Palm Green. With only 40 trees left in the wild, the Carpoxylon Palm is listed as Critically Endangered.

Redwood Red. The redwood species contains the largest and tallest trees in the world. Endangered due to habitat losses.

NEWS!! Our backers have wished for a black, so we've made it in black.

Bat Black. Fruit bats are critical plant pollinators, and their distribution of seeds from the wild fruit that they eat helps forests grow back. 

 

71,910 km² of forest is cut down every year to make single-use tissues for the US alone. That's the size of Rhode Island, Delaware, Connecticut, New Jersey, and New Hampshire COMBINED, and this is for something you use ones and throw away. 

By reusing we are eliminating the need for a product that uses our resources, is manufactured, packaged and shipped constantly. In the long run, you save money, save the planet and in this case a whole lot of trees!  

Change our everyday actions in order to change our lives and the world will change with us.

 

Please help us grow the LastTissue community and reduce the deforestation of our earth. Click on a button below and spread some love for the planet.

Change your habits for the good of the planet in a fuss-free way. Buy LastTissue once, cross single-use tissues off your shopping list forever, and do your bit for the environment. Easy. 

 

Last year we made LastSwab that was crowdfunded with more than 30,000 backers (THANK YOU).

The last year has been quite a ride. We have learned the following, be 100% sure we are shipping plastic-free, be 100% sure we are shipping EU and US-friendly, make all molds before launch, do a test-production run before launch and make sure to deliver on time or before promises. 

Everything has been set up, we are ready and so excited to share LastTissue with all of you. We just hope that Murphy and his Law don't come around. If he does, we will work around the clock until we've fixed the issues and we promise to communicate openly about everything.

 

Nicolas Aagaard (left) has created industrial design for a number of years. He is our the-big-picture, this-can-be-scaled, rendering expert, excel and business shark designer.

Isabel Aagaard (center) has a background in designing medical equipment. She is our graphical quality first, GIF fanatic, coffee brewing, scissor cutout ✂️, eco collaborative designer.

Kåre Frandsen (right) is trained as a cabinetmaker. He is our hands-on, built-a-set-in-a-day, i-can-use-all-tools, cleaning expert, never negative, real prototype and production expert designer.

 

At LastObject we are always dedicated to creating sustainable alternatives to single-use items in pursuit of a cleaner environment. Since our successful launch on Indiegogo with LastSwab our small team has crowned into a handful of Waste Warriors that share the same goal from all over the globe.

-To eliminate single-use items globally- 

 

 

We work with trusted American, Canadian and French partners that have all been sourcing out of China for more than 10 years. They take pride in making sure all their factories have verified certification. Good work conditions, a responsible supply of materials and recycling are all areas that are supported in our factories.

 

 

From our last Kickstarter (LastSwab) we learned that tooling (molds) and tests take an awfully long time, so this time everything has been sourced beforehand and all molds tested.

 

We have even made a test production of 1000 pieces that have been handed out to people for testing and feedback. We have done this so you can receive a high-quality product within three months of the campaign ending.

All pledges are shipped from Denmark with the exception of US addresses, they will be shipped from the US. This way no Europeans or US citizens will be taxed or charged extra VAT.

We are shipping 100% plastic-free.

 

Please note that people living outside of Europe and The US will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to their region.

With only 40 trees left in the wild, the Carpoxylon Palm is listed as Critically Endangered.Redwood Red. The redwood species contains the largest and tallest trees in the world. Endangered due to habitat losses.NEWS!! Our backers have wished for a black, so we've made it in black.Bat Black. Fruit bats are critical plant pollinators, and their distribution of seeds from the wild fruit that they eat helps forests grow back.  71,910 km² of forest is cut down every year to make single-use tissues for the US alone. That's the size of Rhode Island, Delaware, Connecticut, New Jersey, and New Hampshire COMBINED, and this is for something you use ones and throw away. By reusing we are eliminating the need for a product that uses our resources, is manufactured, packaged and shipped constantly. In the long run, you save money, save the planet and in this case a whole lot of trees!  Change our everyday actions in order to change our lives and the world will change with us. 
 Please help us grow the LastTissue community and reduce the deforestation of our earth. Click on a button below and spread some love for the planet. 
  
  
 
 Change your habits for the good of the planet in a fuss-free way. Buy LastTissue once, cross single-use tissues off your shopping list forever, and do your bit for the environment. Easy.  
 
 
behind LastSwab
 Last year we made LastSwab that was crowdfunded with more than 30,000 backers (THANK YOU).The last year has been quite a ride. We have learned the following, be 100% sure we are shipping plastic-free, be 100% sure we are shipping EU and US-friendly, make all molds before launch, do a test-production run before launch and make sure to deliver on time or before promises. Everything has been set up, we are ready and so excited to share LastTissue with all of you. We just hope that Murphy and his Law don't come around. If he does, we will work around the clock until we've fixed the issues and we promise to communicate openly about everything. 
 Nicolas Aagaard (left) has created industrial design for a number of years. He is our the-big-picture, this-can-be-scaled, rendering expert, excel and business shark designer.Isabel Aagaard (center) has a background in designing medical equipment. She is our graphical quality first, GIF fanatic, coffee brewing, scissor cutout ✂️, eco collaborative designer.Kåre Frandsen (right) is trained as a cabinetmaker. He is our hands-on, built-a-set-in-a-day, i-can-use-all-tools, cleaning expert, never negative, real prototype and production expert designer. 
 At LastObject we are always dedicated to creating sustainable alternatives to single-use items in pursuit of a cleaner environment. Since our successful launch on Indiegogo with LastSwab our small team has crowned into a handful of Waste Warriors that share the same goal from all over the globe.-To eliminate single-use items globally- 

 
  
In collaboration with     
 We work with trusted American, Canadian and French partners that have all been sourcing out of China for more than 10 years. They take pride in making sure all their factories have verified certification. Good work conditions, a responsible supply of materials and recycling are all areas that are supported in our factories.  From our last Kickstarter (LastSwab) we learned that tooling (molds) and tests take an awfully long time, so this time everything has been sourced beforehand and all molds tested. We have even made a test production of 1000 pieces that have been handed out to people for testing and feedback. We have done this so you can receive a high-quality product within three months of the campaign ending. 

 All pledges are shipped from Denmark with the exception of US addresses, they will be shipped from the US. This way no Europeans or US citizens will be taxed or charged extra VAT.We are shipping 100% plastic-free. Please note that people living outside of Europe and The US will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to their region. 
 
download  
 
as seen on
 
Risks and challenges
MANUFACTURING:
•We’ve made a test run of 1000 pieces and found a few improvements for the final product, because of this test we are confident that everything will be going smoothly, but unforeseen things might occur, if this should happen we promise to communicate honestly about it, please read our updates here on IndieGoGo for more information.
•We have chosen the same manufacture as we use for LastSwab + an extra manufacture so if something will cause a delay, we will hopefully still be able to ensure timely delivery.
SHIPPING:
•We will start sending LastTissue boxes out as soon as all orders are packed and sent to our two fulfillment services in Texas (The US) and Copenhagen (Denmark).
•Please note that if you live outside The US and Europe you will be responsible for duties, fees, and taxes applicable to your region. PRODUCT GUARANTEE:
•LastTissue comes with a two-year warranty. Should you experience problems with defects you can send it back to us, we’ll happily recycle it and send you a new one for free.
•And remember ''There Is No Planet B''
•Please help us spread the word by sharing our links above.
 
Environmental commitments
Long-lasting design
The silicone case will last you a lifetime. The tissues can be washed 500 times each. Psst probably longer.
Reusability and recyclability
We are all about reusability, one pack of LastTissues can be used at more than 3000 times. The tissues are Organic cotton and therefore can go into organic trash. The silicone case will last you a lifetime and can be refilled with tissues. The packaging is made from non coated cardboard and paper and we are shipping 100% plastic-free.
Sustainable materials
We are using Organic Cotton for the tissues. The Silicone case will last you a lifetime, but if you decide to dispose of it then it's 100% recyclable at select locations — non-hazardous waste.
Sustainable Distribution
Our fulfillment partners have guarantied us to be shipping 100% plastic free.

story:
Whether your electric car needs an emergency roadside supercharge, or you just want to be the superhero of the next tailgate party, Sparkbox is the High Power portable electric generator you don't realize you’ve been waiting for. Powerful enough to charge a car yet small enough to fit in the trunk. Sparkbox is proven once again that great things come in small packages.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

1.) How do I charge my Sparkbox? Plug it into any AC outlet.

2.) How long does it take to fully charge a Sparkbox? Approximately 3 hours.

3.) How much does Sparkbox weigh? Final production units will weigh approximately 55 pounds and we have added convenient integrated handles to the production deign

4.) Will there be a 240V version? Yes, there will be a 120V version and a 240V version shipped and released at the same time. You will select your desired version during the post-campaign survey.

5.) Does Sparkbox come with a warranty? Yes, a full 2 year manufacturer warranty and has been tested to endure 1,000’s of recharges.

6.) Will there be a 12V CLA integrated? Yes, your production Sparkbox will include a 12V receptacle port that will fit most automotive 12V accessories along with 2 USB ports and a dual AC outlet.

7.) Will Sparkbox be rugged enough for outdoor use? Production units will be weather resistant, splash resistant, have integrated wheels and be rugged for outdoor use.

8.) What about using a Sparkbox indoors? Since it requires no fuel, is quiet and has zero emissions – it is perfect for shelters, basements, medical equipment emergency back-up, power tool & battery charger power source, any location where AC electrical power is needed.

 

 

 

With over 30 years experience in manufacturing consumer electronics the SparkBox team has done 12 months of preparation up to this point. We have an agreement with our factory, we have agreed upon costs, we have a production timeline and have a team to assist in production coordination. The battery technology is solid and our battery source is UL approved. Our goal is to reduce the size of Sparkbox, but that will not cause any delays. We have a world class logistics house who has already tested shipping the samples and we do not see any issues shipping these batteries in the US or EU. The team is made up of two members who have delivered 4 other successful Kickstarter campaigns. The design is complete, the PCB's are laid out and we are teamed with a world class manufacturer that we have worked with before. There are always challenges, but we don't see any risk. We have set our goal to meet our production minimum order quantities this way we will deliver if we hit our goal.

story:
Apollo Pro is now unavailable.

ELECJET's new graphene power bank - Apollo Traveller was launched on April, 2019.

Click the link and get 20% OFF discount for pre-ordering.

<Apollo Traveller Pre-Ordering Link>

 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Apollo, the world's first portable power pack using graphene composite battery and USB C PD technology. It supports up to charge at 60W, which means the battery with capacity of 6000mAh can be fully charged in 20 minutes or so if using the USB-C 60W Adapter.

 Super Fast Charging 

Super Fast Charging with the adapter of MacBook Pro 13" 60W

 

 

Specifications

Compatibility

Apollo supports the Power Delivery 3 protocol. You needn’t bring a separate adapter with you, because it is compatible with USB C power adapters of Nintendo Switch, Apple MacBook, Lenovo laptop ,Dell laptop or HP laptop.

If you have only old laptop chargers or MagSafe adapters, you can also use our Anywatt adapter to charge Apollo. 

Besides, Apollo supports 40W USB C PD output, which means it supports the Fast Charging of the latest iPhone 8 or iPhone X, or in an emergency, it supports emergency charge to your Apple Macboook .

Graphene Composite Battery Inside

Apollo realizes application of graphene composite cell to mobile power pack for the first time in the world (Graphene composite Provided by CellsX) . On the basis of the same capacity and the same charging current, the cell with graphene composite material has much smaller internal resistance and better conductivity. Therefore, the temperature rise is lower during super fast charging, so it is safer, and cell swelling and burning will never happen.

Graphene Battery Charging Performance Test in 8C Rate ( 2500mAh cell Charging in 20A Current) 
Surface Temperature of  Graphene Battery Charging Performance Test in 8C Rate

Final Temperature of Graphene Battery Charging Performance Test in 8C Rate After Fully Charged. (Noted: 8C Charging Rate which means fully charged in about 7 mins)

Roadmap Of the Graphene Composite Battery Power Pack

Those Graphene Composite Battery cells and the related technology are provided by CellsX ( Also Called NESC in China),  they have spent more than 13 years in the Graphene Battery Cell Technology. We met each other four years ago and we were asked to made the first Graphene Power Bank with their Gen1 Battery ( 60C Charging Rate, 2400mAh) for them, and later we updated it by their Gen2 Battery (30C Charging Rate, 3500mAh) during the next two years.  However, there has two problems in the Gen 1 and Gen 2:

1. 60C or 30C is far more enough when it is applied  in Power Pack ( 5C would be enough) . 

3. Much Smaller Capacity than actual Market requirement. 

Therefore, CellsX had spent more than 3 years to make it smaller in Charging Rate from 60C to 10C  and Higher Capacity from 2400mah to 6000mah in Same size ( Shown as below) ,  and finally, the lastest battery cell was in mass production in Jan 2017 and We used to design the Gen 3rd Power Pack. 

The idea of Apollo Power Bank is confirmed as USB C PD technology is more and more popular, in Gen 1 or Gen 2 Power Pack, it still needed separate adapter to charge it. So we decided to make it compatible with all the USB C PD adapter.  Therefore, we designed the Apollo with USB C PD 3.0 and Called it Gen 4th. 

 The Apollo is all based on the Pre-Mass Production and Feedback of our Gen 3rd (Working in it now). most problems have been solved during Gen 3rd, Apollo will be optimized based on the Gen 3rd, it is likely to have the new features including:

1. CellsX Claimed the Version 4 Battery Cell will improve the capacity in  about 10%-15% in 3~6 months later , if it will be, Apollo will update to about 7000mah when shipment .

2. Improving the Charging effective and lowering heating 

3. Optimized the assembly & Testing process 

4. Try the possibility to  Update the input from 60W to  87W.

One more thing to be noted it that, in Gen 3,  as the bolt voltage of  traditional battery cell is 3V while the Graphene Battery is capable to 2.5V, therefore, the Graphene battery is able to be charged in large current at the beginning, however, one of the chipset, is called 8805, is defined by traditional cell, it will only allowing to charge it in very small current at the beginning, therefore, in 0%-1% it will take about 3-4 min to power up while in 99%-100% will take 4mins. 

Therefore, in Gen 3, the totally charging current is about 27mins (20 min to charge about 98%). We'll try to make it possible to make the charging time in both 0-1% and 99%-100% shorter.

ELECJET TEAM have run anywatt and assisted to run C-Force, if you are Backers from those two projects, you might know that, unlike other projects, we will launch the project before it is 100% not risk in Mass Product and we will provide after-sales services to all the backers. To achieve it, we will release about Gen 3rd into the market where it is manufacturing (China)  for testing the reliability.

Rewards

Our last campaign :  AnyWatt | A Revolutionary Multifunctional Adapter

 

Apollo Accessories Selectio

Thank you for all your supports. We’re a group engineers who working with USB C for more than 5 years. Therefore, we’re able to develop the innovative product like Anywatt and Apollo. Many backers sent us messages or left comments to us inquiring about the detail accessories information, as the USB C expert , we have been developing many USB C accessories, therefore, we decided to launch it advance in this Kickstarter Project and offering 20%-50% off only for our Dear Backers （shipping fee is included when shipping with Apollo together）, please check it as below:


There are three PD Adapters, all working with widely range of input from 100-240V , Please refer to the picture below.  

For 45W PD Adapter, there are only US Type and EU Type, not interchangeable plug.

However, we have two types of 60W PD adapters, please check the comparison as below. Personally, if you travel often, We would recommend the PD60W001 as it is much portable than the PD60W002 and less weight, it works with Apollo perfectly.

If you wish to have one of those accessories, please add $xx extra to your current pledge, we will send out the Survey to everyone 3-7 working days after it ends.

 

Other Graphene Composite Battery Applications

The biggest features of the Graphene Composite Battery is Super Fast Charging and long cycling time. They also working the project of  City Delivery e-Vehicle System, which can be fully charged in 15mins～25mins and about 80-100km mileage.

Risks and challenges

As Stated previous, We have finished the Gen 3rd Power Bank pre-mass production, most problems have been solved during Gen 3rd, this project, Apollo is based on the feedback of Gen 3rd, and will be optimized based on the Gen 3rd. So the mass-production of Apollo won’t be delay so much as promised. The biggest Challenges is the logistics shipping as the power pack is forbidden to ship in most International Shipping Carrier with Standard Shipping. However, we 
have run anywatt ) and assisted to run C-Force and we also have been selling product in our website ( www.elecjet.com ) for over 1 year. Therefore, we planed to work with our Shipping agency “4PX” , they have more than 20 warehouses all over the world and 3 in USA, those local warehouse is able to ship the Apollo Power Pack.

story:
Growers of all kinds, at any skill level, can easily control and manage their operation right from their mobile device using the all-in-one GrowDirector controller. It enables both monitoring and managing the growth of your plants, vegetables, or herbs using a simple and intuitive interface.

The system is easy to configure with no prior knowledge, technical
experience, or background required for software configuration process.
It is so simple to use. You can have your very own garden in three easy steps:

 The uniquely designed command center reduces errors and effort by providing pre-set programs and control from afar. It connects to all standard sensors, without forcing you to buy a certain brands , and it's scalable, so if you add plants you don't need to add contollers!

Growers of all kinds, at any skill level, can easily control and manage their operation right from their mobile device using the all-in-one GrowDirector device. If you want to grow a plant, this is the way to go!







Say goodbye to the confusion and stress caused by the old way of growing. GrowDirector eliminates the need for multiple different apparatuses that don't connect.


 


 

 

Months upon months of planning, market research, building prototype after prototype, programming, and more research has led to what we believe is the perfect controller for home-growing. This convenient design is everything a home-grower needs and more.

 

 

What sensor and timer brands are compatible with GrowDirector?

You can use any brand you want with GrowDirector! We do not require you to go out and buy any specific types of sensors or brands.

 

What if I don’t know how to set all my timers and sensors?

You don’t have to worry about setting anything yourself with our pre-set programs! Just select what you are growing and let control your plants from anywhere! But our advanced growers also have the opportunity to create custom programs- setting all timers and programs exactly the way you please.

 

What exactly is it for?

GrowDirector can be used to grow everything and anything you want at home.

 

How much am I able to grow with this controller?

There is no limit to the amount you can grow. This little controller can handle it all.

story:
With PaperSoil, jar gardening was never so easy!

A Fresh Idea

A completely new technology that replaces the traditional soil with recycled colored paper, contributing to the protection of the environment in an entertaining way.

Eco-Friendly

Our product was already certified by SGS, world's leading inspection, verification, testing and certification company, ensuring that PaperSoil meets European Union environment standards.

An Easy Method

Plant the seed and then just water them. PaperSoil technology is ideal to prompt the growing of plants.

Why PaperSoil?

Uses recycled paper that saves trees, water and energy, more hygienic and convenient, easy to grow and don’t take up much space.

PaperSoil employs 100% recycled paper to replace the traditional soil of jar plants. It’s a colorful, environmental friendly way to add zen to you for those who have a green thumb, or just love plants but with not much space and time.

PaperSoil Grow Period

 

Color Options

Because indiegogo only provide 5 values for each item options, we have more color options for you.So we choose not offering any options.Please leave comments to us after you order any one.The comments must include your order number and the color you want.Thank you.

Shipping !

We have the inventory to ship products to you,and we can begin shipping on time ,so don't worry to support us.

Kindly Reminder : Because of international regulations, our shippings does not include seeds. We recommend that you can buy seeds at flower shop or warehouse. Thank you.

Risks and challenges

We know what we're doing, and we have started preparing the fabrication. Once we hit the goal, delivery should be no problem. You should be very confident that we will deliver what we say we will, when we say we will. We do have sent out more than 20 beta version samples to reporters for review. So we have tried the pilot production. But we do not want to say something 100%, nothing is 100%.

Supply Chain Risk: We're incredibly proud of our supply chain, and have a lot of confidence that we can make what we say we'll make, when we say we'll make it. But shipment sometimes is tricky, we may not be able to keep the schedule if the backers are too many. And the custom is also a risk factor. However, those are normally controllable, just may be a bit of late.

PaperSoil technology is ideal to prompt the growing of plants.Why PaperSoil?Uses recycled paper that saves trees, water and energy, more hygienic and convenient, easy to grow and don’t take up much space.PaperSoil employs 100% recycled paper to replace the traditional soil of jar plants. It’s a colorful, environmental friendly way to add zen to you for those who have a green thumb, or just love plants but with not much space and time.PaperSoil Grow Period Color OptionsBecause indiegogo only provide 5 values for each item options, we have more color options for you.So we choose not offering any options.Please leave comments to us after you order any one.The comments must include your order number and the color you want.Thank you.Shipping !We have the inventory to ship products to you,and we can begin shipping on time ,so don't worry to support us.Kindly Reminder : Because of international regulations, our shippings does not include seeds. We recommend that you can buy seeds at flower shop or warehouse. Thank you.Risks and challengesWe know what we're doing, and we have started preparing the fabrication. Once we hit the goal, delivery should be no problem. You should be very confident that we will deliver what we say we will, when we say we will. We do have sent out more than 20 beta version samples to reporters for review. So we have tried the pilot production. But we do not want to say something 100%, nothing is 100%.Supply Chain Risk: We're incredibly proud of our supply chain, and have a lot of confidence that we can make what we say we'll make, when we say we'll make it. But shipment sometimes is tricky, we may not be able to keep the schedule if the backers are too many. And the custom is also a risk factor. However, those are normally controllable, just may be a bit of late.

story:
This is not your ordinary crowdfund project. Here we try something truly different. 

Smartup Zero is the first Smartup in the world. A Smartup is a new type of company that is working on technologies that help people all over the world to work on the Sustainable Development Goals. Smartup Zero is creating a technology called Onlive. Onlive is an app to connect people with their own environment, instead of the world. 

I've built a prototype. Now I want to built the actual Onlive platform together with you. I've set up an organization for that. 

The main question to you:
Do you want to become my Smartup Co-Owner and start owning, creating and governing our own technologies, starting with Onlive?? 


The structure:

  1. Summary of the full proposal 'Smartup Zero: a Blueprint for Disruption'  
  2. Quick guide to Smartup
  3. The official Smartup Business Plan about Onlive. (READ THIS IF YOU JUST WANT TO FIND OUT WHAT WE ARE GOING TO BUILD)

Resources:

  1. Full proposal
  2. The project website 
  3. More video's
  4. Background story
  5. Onlive prototype mockup (interactive)

1. Summary


Two years ago, we started working on a new type of social network. We called it ‘Onlive’. The social network was intended to be the antidote to the big technology companies that have been busy connecting us with the online world. We’d imagine a platform that does the opposite: one that connects us with our offline worlds. One that stimulates face to face human interaction, encourages dialogue and the exchange of ideas, right here on the streets of our communities. We were trying to create a social network between the online world and the offline world. 

As the research progressed, we realized we were designing something more than a social network. We were designing an operating system (OS) for people to interact with their immediate physical world. An OS that connects you with the people, organizations, and technologies around you in real-time, offering relevant information and functionality for almost any conceivable situation. Our research project resulted in a prototype application for Android, a solid software architecture, a UX design and a thorough research report on our findings (READ ALL ABOUT THIS IN PART 3: THE OFFICIAL SMARTUP BUSINESS PLAN). 

Now it is up to me to take this project to the next phase: creating a Minimal Viable Product (MVP), find the funding and set up a startup. The thing is, founding a startup might be considered the ‘logical’ next step, but is it the ‘best’ step? I think Onlive is something special and has the potential to offer counterweight against the dominance of traditional social networks. I believe Onlive can become a platform that can help us organize the online world in manageable and easy to use cards and make them applicable for use in our communities, where they can be of value the most.

At the same time, I am growing more aware of the scientific call for a fundamental system change. A change that is critical if we want to protect the only planet we have. I am convinced Onlive can contribute to one of the thousands of solutions that are needed in that quest. Specifically by being a trustworthy technology that will support us creating and applying these solutions faster but also because the same scientists urge us to attack the global problems from a local level. The idea is that if we all fix our own communities, we together, fix the world.

Onlive is a tool designed to connect with our own communities. However, to become that tool it has to become the best version of itself. Anything less would make it just another social network. I realized I could not just follow the normal startup trajectory to ensure that. I needed to create a different environment. One that maximizes the chance for Onlive to become a reliable, robust and trustworthy technology that purely serves the planet and humanity, and not the bank account of its shareholders.

That is why I designed a new type of organization that I call the Smartup. In a Smartup we can own, create and govern our technologies and operate completely autonomously, independently and be self-sustained. It creates and exploits, like any other company, a product or service, while providing jobs for people. However, a Smartup is run as a democratic society where people decide together what we make, how we make it and, above all, why we should make it. The goal of a Smartup is to nurture great ideas for a better future and allow them to become the best versions of themselves. By democratizing the process of owning, building and governing technologies, we can create products and services that are useful to people in their efforts protecting our planet and humanity.

I think Onlive is the perfect technology to test this idea. It’s a well-researched project about a new medium that wants people to use the online world to improve their own local world. I've set up operation Smartup Zero and am recruiting right now. I ask you to join me and be my co-pioneer, embrace the potential and work hard on realizing it. Let’s prove there is a different path. One that enables everyone of us to collectively be part of the solution, a channel for our energy, love and talent. Let's unlock the true potential of the internet by building our own operating system, unlocking not just the best of the online world, but reconnecting us to with our local communities. In my essay ‘Smartup Zero: a blueprint for disruption’ I’ll show you how this new OS will help us navigate through a blizzard of problems that undeniably are coming at us, if they are not already here. 

2. A quick guide to Smartup:

 

3. The official Smartup Business Plan

 1-10-2019

 

 

Smartup Zero - The Official Smartup Business Plan (Validation Ready) -

Onlive: the social information network for the real world. 

This is the start of the validation round for Smartup Zero. We are finding out if there is enough will to share ownership in the Onlive proposition. We measure that viability in this round by selling Smartup Ownership.

Smartup Ownership

Being an owner of a Smartup is not about who created the idea or had the money to invest, it's about who is willing to own and grow an idea into the best version it can become. The more people step up to that plate, the healthier your Smartup becomes, the better the product or service it produces and the higher the profits that return from the market will be.

In a lot of ways, being the owner of a Smartup is more being like being a citizen of a new country than a shareholder of a new company. You are expected to contribute to the creation of the country.

You've got all kinds of rights and at least one obligation: to be responsible for what the Smartup is creating. With your rights, you can perform that responsibility. You've got the right to vote, supervise and work but are also obliged to offer your best and participate in good faith and with good intention if you want to keep those rights.

To show your good faith and good intention as an owner, you can get busy with two processes in a Smartup:

  1. To Work 
  2. To Govern 

​You work for money and you govern for the protection of the mission and vision. Ideally, you do both with the same intensity. 

There are a lot more things to understand about the concept of a Smartup, but in essence, it's about your will to own Onlive with me. 

if you do, than buy one of the perks and I'll see you in the first Smartup in the world.

story:
English version after the French version

Le concept !

Réalisons tous ensemble la maison de demain !

Ensemble nous pouvons créer une maison qui répond à tous les besoins. Une maison qui est intelligente, économique, écologique, autosuffisante, qui respecte notre environnement et qui subvient en grande partie à vos besoins alimentaires. Une maison autonome et passive ; qui ne nécessite pas de raccordement à : l’électricité, l’eau, et pas de circuit d’évacuation des eaux usées.

Une illustration de la maison autonome

Elle produira également suffisamment de fruits et de légumes (environ 400kg) toute l’année pour les besoins d’une famille de 4 à 5 personnes et environ 40kg de poisson. La serre permet une économie de 90% en eau comparée à une culture classique.

Une illustration de l'aquaponie

La maison est conçue pour consommer très peu de ressources grâce à sa réalisation de paille et de bois, son orientation sur le terrain pour bénéficier du chauffage naturel du soleil, la récupération d’eau de pluie et l’épuration des eaux usées par les plantes. Les panneaux solaires sur le toit et en façade permettent d’apporter suffisamment d’électricité pour la maison, le surplus est stocké dans des batteries pour restituer l’électricité quand la nuit est tombée.

La domotique qui est présente dans le logement permet une gestion minutieuse de l’électricité, elle s’occupe de couper le courant des prises pendant votre absence afin d’éliminer la veille des appareils, d’éteindre les lumières restées allumées par erreur. Elle permet également de gérer la serre aquaponie, afin de contrôler l’état des plantes et du système à distance et en tout temps.

Ce concept peut être utilisé pour un immeuble, une maison, et pourquoi par un restaurant…

Ce type de logement coûte généralement plus cher qu’un logement classique, mais afin de résoudre ce problème nous avons réfléchi à un moyen pour rendre ce type de logement accessible à tous. L’Open source !

Nous travaillons avec des architectes et ingénieurs pour la conception du logement, nous travaillons avec des solutions Open source pour la création de panneaux chauffants, de bassins de récupération des eaux, de la serre, des meubles et de la domotique. Cela permet de faire une économie de plus de 40% sur la construction de la maison. Afin de réduire les coûts, nous avons créé plusieurs bibliothèques libres de droits (Open source) afin de vous aider à réaliser votre maison de manière économique et écologique.

Elles comprennent des plans, des guides et tutoriels pour la réalisation et le montage de plusieurs éléments qui touchent à l’écologie : Énergie solaire, récupération de l'eau de pluie, chauffage passif, bio-isolation et bien plus encore ; des meubles, la conception de votre solution domotique, de multiples capteurs et actionneurs.

Il vous suffira de prendre contact avec l’un de nos partenaires-architectes de différentes régions afin d’adapter les plans selon vos besoins et votre terrain.

Une illustration de la maison modulaire. Panneau composé de paille et de bois

Qui suis-je ?

Je suis informaticien de métier, passionné de technologie, je réalise des meubles et des projets électroniques depuis l’âge de 15 ans, j’ai été intégrateur de solution domotique pendant près de 5 ans. J’aimerais améliorer notre monde d’aujourd’hui et de demain pour nos enfants. Depuis plusieurs années je suis devenu sensible à notre environnement, à notre façon de gérer nos ressources et les aliments que nous consommons.

Je rêve depuis de nombreuses années de la ville « parfaite » qui à mes yeux serait autonome en ressource comme l’électricité, autonome en nourriture grâce à des serres aquaponie qui permettraient de nourrir des familles entières en économisant l’eau et en fournissant des aliments de qualité. Une ville intelligente avec des véhicules (voitures, bus, métro, train, etc.) autonomes qui communiqueraient entre eux afin d’éliminer les accidents, les embouteillages, la pollution.

Mais avant d’atteindre ce résultat, il faut que nous travaillions tous ensemble pour arriver à améliorer nos logements et notre façon de consommer nos ressources. C’est pour cette raison que je lance cette campagne.

Grâce à vous !

En finançant ce projet, nous pourrons réaliser cette maison passive et nous allons créer une communauté d’auto constructeur par région. Des constructions réalisées en groupe d'amis et de parents. Dans ce modèle de production sociale, chacun apporte ses connaissances, et ses expériences, ce qui permet également de faire des ateliers éducatifs intéressants et conviviaux.

Les bibliothèques mises à disposition sont entièrement Open source, ce qui signifie que non seulement vous pouvez les utiliser gratuitement, mais également toute personne peut proposer des plans, des réalisations, des tutos.

La contribution d’une communauté mondiale permet également de répondre à des exigences spécifiques à tout type de climat, mais également à la disponibilité des matériaux et des spécificités culturelles.

Cette campagne de financement couvrira les frais suivants : 

  • Ingénieur bioclimatique
  • Architecte
  • Location d’un dépôt pour réaliser des prototypes
  • Achat d’équipements et de matériel
  • Poursuite du développement des différentes solutions pour réaliser une maison encore plus économe en énergie et toujours plus intelligente.
  • Développement de notre plateforme pour devenir la référence de l’Open source qui touche à la conception du logement et de son aménagement pour avoir une communauté importante et diversifiée à travers le monde.

L'impact

Nous pouvons faire changer la façon de se loger et d’utiliser nos ressources. Si nous sommes nombreux à réaliser des logements économes et passifs, nous réduirons considérablement l’impact négatif sur notre environnement. Nous laisserons à nos enfants les bons réflexes pour préserver notre terre et nous nourrir sainement.

Risques et défis

  • Les récompenses que nous proposons sont déjà en grande partie réalisées et en place, dès la fin de la campagne la plupart des contreparties seront accessibles.
  • Le site internet est déjà en place, il s’étoffe de semaine en semaine afin de fournir un contenu intéressant et varié.
  • Nous travaillons avec un ingénieur bioclimatique et un architecte pour la conception du logement et fournir des plans de qualité et surtout fonctionnels.
  • Nous sommes conscients que le projet est conséquent, que nous n’arriverons pas à sortir la maison parfaite tout de suite, c’est pour cette raison que nous ferons évoluer régulièrement les plans, et les documents mis à disposition.

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous n’avez pas la possibilité de soutenir financièrement notre projet, mais que vous souhaitez nous soutenir, n’hésitez pas à partager cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux, à vos amis, familles et toute personne soucieuse de notre environnement.

Les contreparties

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The concept

Let us carry out the altogether house of tomorrow!

Together we can create a home that meets all needs. A home that is smart, economical, ecological, self-sufficient, respects our environment and largely meets your food needs. An autonomous and passive house; Which does not require connection to: electricity, water, and no sewage system.

An illustration of the self-contained house

It will also produce enough fruits and vegetables (about 400kg) all year round for the needs of a family of 4 to 5 people and about 40kg of fish. The greenhouse saves 90% of water compared to a conventional crop.

An illustration of aquapony

The house is designed to consume very little resources thanks to its realization of straw and wood, its orientation on the ground to benefit from the natural heating of the sun, the recovery of rainwater and the purification of the waste water by the plants . Solar panels on the roof and on the façade provide enough electricity for the house, the surplus is stored in batteries to restore electricity when night falls.

The home automation system in the housing allows meticulous management of electricity, it is able to cut the current of the outlets during your absence in order to eliminate the watches of the apparatuses, to turn off the lights that were lit by mistake. It also helps manage the greenhouse aquapony, to control the state of plants and the system remotely and at all times.

This concept can be used for a building, a house, and why by a restaurant ...

This type of accommodation usually costs more than a conventional dwelling, but in order to solve this problem we have considered a way to make this type of housing accessible to all. Open Source!

We work with architects and engineers to design housing, we work with open source solutions for the creation of heating panels, water recovery ponds, greenhouse, furniture and home automation. This saves more than 40% on the construction of the house. To reduce costs, we have created several open source libraries to help you realize your home economically and environmentally.

They include plans, guides and tutorials for the construction and assembly of several elements that affect the ecology: solar energy, rainwater recovery, passive heating, bio-insulation and much more; Furniture, design of your home automation solution, multiple sensors and actuators.

All you have to do is contact one of our architect partners from different regions to adapt the plans according to your needs and your terrain.

An illustration of the modular house. Panel made of straw and wood

Who am I?

I am IT engineer, impassioned technology, I have been making furniture and electronic projects since the age of 15 years, I was integrator of home automation solution for nearly 5 years. I would love to improve our world today and tomorrow for our children. For several years I have become sensitive to our environment, how we manage our resources and the foods we consume.

I dreamed since many years of the “perfect” city which in my eyes would be autonomous in resource like electricity, autonomous in food thanks to aquaponics greenhouse which would make it possible to nourish whole families by saving water and by providing food of quality. An intelligent city with autonomous vehicles (cars, bus, subway, train, etc.) which would communicate between them in order to eliminate accidents, congestions and pollution.

But to reach this result, it is necessary to work all together to manage improving our residences and our way of consuming our resources. For this reason I launch this campaign.

For several years I became sensitive to our environment, our way of managing our resources and the food we consume.

Thank to you!

By financing this project, we will be able to realize this passive house and we will create a community of auto constructor by region. Buildings made in groups of friends and relatives. In this model of social production, each brings his knowledge and his experiences, which also makes it possible to make educational workshops interesting and convivial.

The libraries made available are entirely open source, which means that not only you can use them for free, but also anyone can propose plans, realizations, tutorials.

The contribution of a global community also makes it possible to meet requirements specific to all types of climate, but also to the availability of materials and cultural specificities.

This fundraising campaign will cover the following costs:

  • Bioclimatic engineer
  • Architect
  • Hiring of a space to construct prototypes
  • Purchase of equipment and material
  • Continuous development of various solutions to carry out an even more energy saver and increasingly more intelligent house.
  • Development of our platform to become the OpenSource reference which touches with the design of housing and its installation to have an important and diversified community throughout the world.

Impact

We can make change the way of placing and of using our resources. If we are numerous to carry out sparing and passive residences, we will reduce considerably the negative impact on our environment. We will leave to our children the good reflexes to preserve our ground and to nourish ourselves healthily.

Risks and challenges

  • The rewards which we propose are already mainly carried out and in place, as of the end of the campaign most counterparts will be accessible.
  • The website is already in places, it is packed week in week in order to provide interesting and varied contents.
  • We work with a bioclimatic engineer and an architect for the housing design and to provide quality  and especially functional plans.
  • We are conscious that the project is consequent, that we will not manage to leave the perfect house immediately, for this reason we will make evolve regularly plans, and documents placed at disposal.

Other ways of helping

If you don’t have the possibility of financially supporting our project, but you wish supporting us, don’t hesitate to share this campaign over social networks, with your friends, families and any concerned person of our environment.

The counterparts

Cela permet de faire une économie de plus de 40% sur la construction de la maison. Afin de réduire les coûts, nous avons créé plusieurs bibliothèques libres de droits (Open source) afin de vous aider à réaliser votre maison de manière économique et écologique.

Elles comprennent des plans, des guides et tutoriels pour la réalisation et le montage de plusieurs éléments qui touchent à l’écologie : Énergie solaire, récupération de l'eau de pluie, chauffage passif, bio-isolation et bien plus encore ; des meubles, la conception de votre solution domotique, de multiples capteurs et actionneurs.
Il vous suffira de prendre contact avec l’un de nos partenaires-architectes de différentes régions afin d’adapter les plans selon vos besoins et votre terrain.

Une illustration de la maison modulaire. Panneau composé de paille et de bois
Qui suis-je ?
Je suis informaticien de métier, passionné de technologie, je réalise des meubles et des projets électroniques depuis l’âge de 15 ans, j’ai été intégrateur de solution domotique pendant près de 5 ans. J’aimerais améliorer notre monde d’aujourd’hui et de demain pour nos enfants. Depuis plusieurs années je suis devenu sensible à notre environnement, à notre façon de gérer nos ressources et les aliments que nous consommons.
Je rêve depuis de nombreuses années de la ville « parfaite » qui à mes yeux serait autonome en ressource comme l’électricité, autonome en nourriture grâce à des serres aquaponie qui permettraient de nourrir des familles entières en économisant l’eau et en fournissant des aliments de qualité. Une ville intelligente avec des véhicules (voitures, bus, métro, train, etc.) autonomes qui communiqueraient entre eux afin d’éliminer les accidents, les embouteillages, la pollution.
Mais avant d’atteindre ce résultat, il faut que nous travaillions tous ensemble pour arriver à améliorer nos logements et notre façon de consommer nos ressources. C’est pour cette raison que je lance cette campagne.
Grâce à vous !
En finançant ce projet, nous pourrons réaliser cette maison passive et nous allons créer une communauté d’auto constructeur par région. Des constructions réalisées en groupe d'amis et de parents. Dans ce modèle de production sociale, chacun apporte ses connaissances, et ses expériences, ce qui permet également de faire des ateliers éducatifs intéressants et conviviaux.
Les bibliothèques mises à disposition sont entièrement Open source, ce qui signifie que non seulement vous pouvez les utiliser gratuitement, mais également toute personne peut proposer des plans, des réalisations, des tutos.
La contribution d’une communauté mondiale permet également de répondre à des exigences spécifiques à tout type de climat, mais également à la disponibilité des matériaux et des spécificités culturelles.
Cette campagne de financement couvrira les frais suivants : 

Ingénieur bioclimatique
Architecte
Location d’un dépôt pour réaliser des prototypes
Achat d’équipements et de matériel
Poursuite du développement des différentes solutions pour réaliser une maison encore plus économe en énergie et toujours plus intelligente.
Développement de notre plateforme pour devenir la référence de l’Open source qui touche à la conception du logement et de son aménagement pour avoir une communauté importante et diversifiée à travers le monde.

L'impact
Nous pouvons faire changer la façon de se loger et d’utiliser nos ressources. Si nous sommes nombreux à réaliser des logements économes et passifs, nous réduirons considérablement l’impact négatif sur notre environnement. Nous laisserons à nos enfants les bons réflexes pour préserver notre terre et nous nourrir sainement.
Risques et défis

Les récompenses que nous proposons sont déjà en grande partie réalisées et en place, dès la fin de la campagne la plupart des contreparties seront accessibles.
Le site internet est déjà en place, il s’étoffe de semaine en semaine afin de fournir un contenu intéressant et varié.
Nous travaillons avec un ingénieur bioclimatique et un architecte pour la conception du logement et fournir des plans de qualité et surtout fonctionnels.
Nous sommes conscients que le projet est conséquent, que nous n’arriverons pas à sortir la maison parfaite tout de suite, c’est pour cette raison que nous ferons évoluer régulièrement les plans, et les documents mis à disposition.

D'autres façons d'aider
Si vous n’avez pas la possibilité de soutenir financièrement notre projet, mais que vous souhaitez nous soutenir, n’hésitez pas à partager cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux, à vos amis, familles et toute personne soucieuse de notre environnement.
Les contreparties












------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The concept
Let us carry out the altogether house of tomorrow!
Together we can create a home that meets all needs. A home that is smart, economical, ecological, self-sufficient, respects our environment and largely meets your food needs. An autonomous and passive house; Which does not require connection to: electricity, water, and no sewage system.

An illustration of the self-contained house
It will also produce enough fruits and vegetables (about 400kg) all year round for the needs of a family of 4 to 5 people and about 40kg of fish. The greenhouse saves 90% of water compared to a conventional crop.

An illustration of aquapony
The house is designed to consume very little resources thanks to its realization of straw and wood, its orientation on the ground to benefit from the natural heating of the sun, the recovery of rainwater and the purification of the waste water by the plants . Solar panels on the roof and on the façade provide enough electricity for the house, the surplus is stored in batteries to restore electricity when night falls.
The home automation system in the housing allows meticulous management of electricity, it is able to cut the current of the outlets during your absence in order to eliminate the watches of the apparatuses, to turn off the lights that were lit by mistake. It also helps manage the greenhouse aquapony, to control the state of plants and the system remotely and at all times.
This concept can be used for a building, a house, and why by a restaurant ...
This type of accommodation usually costs more than a conventional dwelling, but in order to solve this problem we have considered a way to make this type of housing accessible to all. Open Source!
We work with architects and engineers to design housing, we work with open source solutions for the creation of heating panels, water recovery ponds, greenhouse, furniture and home automation. This saves more than 40% on the construction of the house. To reduce costs, we have created several open source libraries to help you realize your home economically and environmentally.

They include plans, guides and tutorials for the construction and assembly of several elements that affect the ecology: solar energy, rainwater recovery, passive heating, bio-insulation and much more; Furniture, design of your home automation solution, multiple sensors and actuators.
All you have to do is contact one of our architect partners from different regions to adapt the plans according to your needs and your terrain.

An illustration of the modular house. Panel made of straw and wood
Who am I?
I am IT engineer, impassioned technology, I have been making furniture and electronic projects since the age of 15 years, I was integrator of home automation solution for nearly 5 years. I would love to improve our world today and tomorrow for our children. For several years I have become sensitive to our environment, how we manage our resources and the foods we consume.
I dreamed since many years of the “perfect” city which in my eyes would be autonomous in resource like electricity, autonomous in food thanks to aquaponics greenhouse which would make it possible to nourish whole families by saving water and by providing food of quality. An intelligent city with autonomous vehicles (cars, bus, subway, train, etc.) which would communicate between them in order to eliminate accidents, congestions and pollution.
But to reach this result, it is necessary to work all together to manage improving our residences and our way of consuming our resources. For this reason I launch this campaign.
For several years I became sensitive to our environment, our way of managing our resources and the food we consume.
Thank to you!
By financing this project, we will be able to realize this passive house and we will create a community of auto constructor by region. Buildings made in groups of friends and relatives. In this model of social production, each brings his knowledge and his experiences, which also makes it possible to make educational workshops interesting and convivial.
The libraries made available are entirely open source, which means that not only you can use them for free, but also anyone can propose plans, realizations, tutorials.
The contribution of a global community also makes it possible to meet requirements specific to all types of climate, but also to the availability of materials and cultural specificities.
This fundraising campaign will cover the following costs:

Bioclimatic engineer
Architect
Hiring of a space to construct prototypes
Purchase of equipment and material
Continuous development of various solutions to carry out an even more energy saver and increasingly more intelligent house.
Development of our platform to become the OpenSource reference which touches with the design of housing and its installation to have an important and diversified community throughout the world.

Impact
We can make change the way of placing and of using our resources. If we are numerous to carry out sparing and passive residences, we will reduce considerably the negative impact on our environment. We will leave to our children the good reflexes to preserve our ground and to nourish ourselves healthily.
Risks and challenges

The rewards which we propose are already mainly carried out and in place, as of the end of the campaign most counterparts will be accessible.
The website is already in places, it is packed week in week in order to provide interesting and varied contents.
We work with a bioclimatic engineer and an architect for the housing design and to provide quality  and especially functional plans.
We are conscious that the project is consequent, that we will not manage to leave the perfect house immediately, for this reason we will make evolve regularly plans, and documents placed at disposal.

Other ways of helping
If you don’t have the possibility of financially supporting our project, but you wish supporting us, don’t hesitate to share this campaign over social networks, with your friends, families and any concerned person of our environment.
The counterparts

story:
Product Details - Portable System 

2 x Smart USB Ports - ideal for charging mobile devices when you're away from a power source

1 x High Intensity LED Light - the device can support up to three lights at once. They're perfect for providing light for search and rescue, and much more.

1 x Solar Storage Bag - this helps keep your generator, solar panels and equipment safe as you travel. The device is fully portable and lightweight.

1 x Wall Charger - this allows you to charge the generator's internal battery so it's ready to deploy at any time, even if you arrive on the scene during the night.

Meet the eHub 50 Fixed Solar Generator.

INCREDIBLE POWER. SUCH ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY.

You literally have electricity right in the palm of your hand. Thanks to our advanced technology, and our compact design.The sleek compact design of the eHub 50  makes it weighs less than 4 pounds, and can be carried anywhere, or in a book bag. Also if you're taking a long road trip, the portable unit does not take up much room in the car.

The added lightbulbs that comes with the eHub 50 can light up 3 rooms at once!

Product Details - Fixed System​

2 x Smart USB Ports – ideal for charging mobile devices when you’re away from a power source

3 x High Intensity LED Light – the device can support up to three lights at once. They’re perfect for providing light for search and rescue, and much more.

2 x LED eLux switches - that independently provide lighting to additional rooms.

1 x Solar Panel – Fixed solar panel for charging the eHub50. 

1 x Wall Charger – this allows you to charge the generator’s internal battery so that it’s ready to deploy at any time, even if you arrive on scene during the night.

BENEFITS

No Need for Expensive Fuel  - the generator can run on - and be recharged with - 100% solar energy. This means you will have no smoke in the air and you will not need to spend penny on fuel.

Extreme Durability  - unlike some portable heavy generators on the market ours is engineered to a high level of durability. This means - when properly stored - it can withstand the wear and tear of everyday life. It also contains no moving components so it is far less likely to fail than an engine-driven generator.

GLOBAL ENERGY CRISIS.

"..there are over 1.2 Billion people in the world without access to electricity .."

The eHub50 global vision is to focus on energy scarce regions of the world such as the Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, Guam, Philippines, Africa, Latin America, and undeserved communities in the United States of America, such as Community centers and low income communities.

As of 2014, it can be seen that there are 12 countries in Africa that have 20% or less electricity available for their country.This problem is still happening today, and according to the International Energy Agency's World Energy Outlook, there are over 1.2 Billion people in the world without access to electricity  of which 620 million are in Africa, but including Africa the eHub50 is transforming the lives of many people in these developing countries.

The eHub 50 in a rural village in Ethiopia, has greatly enhanced the owner's income. A woman has created a mobile cafe using the the eHub 50 to stay open after the sun goes down and to offer customers charging services for their mobile devices.  Thanks to the eHub 50, her income has increased by more than 300%.

Natural Disasters.

When Hurricane Irma hit the southeastern shore of the United States, it left 6.5 million people in the dark. These people went without lights and electricity.  It was expected that the restoration of power could take a matter of weeks to solve the situations. Because of the constant threat of natural disasters this is why our devices are needed. With our included lightbulb, the eHub50 device would allow people to always have light, electricity, and more!

eHub 50 in the news:

Exclusive: This new effort to fund minority businesses has big-name backer, 'real teeth'

Small Businesses Get Boost With "Project 500" Expansion, Washington D.C. City Officials support the eHub50 Device. 

 

ABOUT US

The innovative eHub50 is developed, designed and manufactured by Dufsar Energy, LLC.  Dufsar Energy, LLC. is an innovative renewable energy company that designs and manufactures the most advanced, reliable, efficient and affordable off-grid solar powered systems. All Dufsar Energy, LLC, products are manufactured in the United States.

Smith & Sons, LLC, a 34-year old company, headquartered in Washington D.C. an alumni of Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Businesses Program, will market, sell and distribute the eHub50 to federal, state & local government and commercial customers.  Smith & Sons, LLC aims to increase the local economy, by establishing a manufacturing plant to build the eHub50.

The eHub50 was developed as a result of a trip that the founder of Dufsar Energy, LLC took to Ethiopia to visit his Grandmother. While in Ethiopia, he was unable to keep his communication devices powered. Recognizing that his Grandmother was impacted in the same manner. Not being able to find a reliable feature-rich solution for her compelled him to put his engineering expertise to work. Within 4-months, a prototype was developed, and after 20 -months of rigorous field-testing, the eHub50 was built. Today, more than 1,000 have been shipped all over the world without any recorded failures.​

The collaboration between the companies is very complimentary, Dufsar Energy, LLC, will continue to innovate renewable energy products and Smith & Sons, LLC, will build a robust distribution system utilizing more than 34-years experience in the Nations Capital to get an eHub50 to everyone, everywhere. 

Smith & Sons, LLC, was the 2017 First Place Winner of the UPS X-Port Challenge Competition.

 

PARTNERS

Within 4-months, a prototype was developed, and after 20 -months of rigorous field-testing, the eHub50 was built. Today, more than 1,000 have been shipped all over the world without any recorded failures.​The collaboration between the companies is very complimentary, Dufsar Energy, LLC, will continue to innovate renewable energy products and Smith & Sons, LLC, will build a robust distribution system utilizing more than 34-years experience in the Nations Capital to get an eHub50 to everyone, everywhere. Smith & Sons, LLC, was the 2017 First Place Winner of the UPS X-Port Challenge Competition. PARTNERS

story:
Order now at : https://shop.zimple3d.com

While you're printing, your 3D printer releases a big amount of fumes, as you may have already smelt. FDM 3D Printing technology is based on the fusion of a thermoplastic filament. This process is known to issue a lot of nanoparticles and gases. All the professional processes based on material fusion have big and efficient exhausting and filtering solutions. We tend to forget it but personal 3D printers are real manufacturing boxes inside our homes, schools or offices.

 

This melting of plastic releases two main potential toxins. Nanoparticles (NP) and Volatile Organic Compound (VOC) gases. 
  
Nanoparticle (NP) and Ultrafine Particles (UFP) are the interchangeable generic terms for any solid particle that is less than 100 nanometers in size. NP/UFPs can present several different kinds of dangers due to not only their composition, which may or may not be toxic, but also their size. 
When inhaled, NP/UFP can become trapped in the very smallest areas of the lung’s alveoli, which are the tiny sacs covered in blood capillaries where oxygen and carbon dioxide are exchanged between the blood stream and the lungs. If they are small enough, the particles can actually pass directly from the lungs into the blood stream. Once they move on to, and accumulate in, other organs in the body such as the brain, the liver, or spleen can be affected
And the particles do not have to be toxic in and of themselves to cause problems or poisoning, so even PLA particles (which currently are widely believed to be non-toxic) can build up in the lungs and cause serious harm. 
   
On the other hand, VOCs can include any number of different chemicals and in varying amounts. For example, in ABS, the VOCs released when the filament is melted can contain 10 to 20 different chemicals, most notably Styrene, a chemical which has been classified as toxic and a possible carcinogen.

Real world example:  

If we consider that one 3D Printer operates continuously in a well-mixed 45 m3 furnished and conditioned office space (Ventilation rate of 1/hour), we observe an ultrafine particles concentration of 58 000 particles/cm3. It’s more than 11 times higher than what we observe in a typical home, office or school ambient air. Regarding the gases: With this configuration, the predicted styrene concentration is about 150µg/m3, which is 20 times higher than the highest styrene concentration measured in commercial buildings in the U.S. That is not acceptable! 
In France, the particles pollution is the 3rd cause of death: more than 48 000 people die every year as a result of particles pollution. We can’t accept even more pollution inside our home!

Source 

Some of the compounds released: 

 

 Ultrafine particles and Volatile Organic Compounds released while you're 3D printing are special: their weight is so low that they don't deal with gravity. In other words, they never fall back and remain in the air. It means that any air stream spread them through every direction. In this way, those particles are given off through the room. 
That's why it's really important not to let them spread by filtering them at the emission source, directly near the nozzle of your printer. This will stop the diffusion in your environment. 

 

  

We also are 3D printing lovers. Nicolas, 3D Designer and Engineer, 3D printers user since many years now, was tired of always letting his window open, and of not being able to print during night. That's why he decided to develop a filtering system compatible with every 3D printer, in order to share his solution with all the 3D printers users that might need it.
   
After smelling the effectiveness of the prototype (once ABS smell had disappeared), we decided to improve and certify our product in order to make it reliable and manufacturable. 
   
This emission of fumes is a global issue for 3D printers users. Some solutions exist, but our solution is unique. You don’t need to build any enclosure because our system isn't just an efficient filtering solution, it's also a powerful hoovering system that aspirates the particles and gases directly where they are produced: in the extrusion nozzle.

    

Zimpure is officially certified to filter 99% of the ultrafine particles and more than 90% of the gases issued by your 3D printer. It has been tested in a laboratory specialized in air pollution (CEA, LSCE department). You can access more information about the testing procedure and the complete results in our certified study report. 

Zimpure combines two filters: 
     One ultrafine particle filter, which filters 99.9% of the UFP released. 
     One gases filter, which filters 98% of the VOC released. 

Our powerful and quiet fan assures you an efficient suction flow: 
     More than 99% of the UFP and 90% of the gases are sucked. 

Ultrafine Particle Concentration without and with Zimpure

This curve was acquired by a CPC, measuring particles from 10nm diameter to 300nm. 
On the left side of the line you can see the UFP (UltraFine Particles) concentration while printing without Zimpure, and on the right side of the line the UFP concentration while printing with Zimpure. 
The average concentration of UFP while printing without using Zimpure is 373 539#/cm3. When Zimpure is plugged, the concentration falls back to 170#/cm3. It means that 99.9% of the UFP are filtered! 

Gases (VOC) concentration without and with Zimpure

  This curve was acquired by a PTRMS, measuring VOC concentration for each atomic mass, in order to know the concentration of each different compound. 
On the left side of the line you can see the VOC concentration while printing without Zimpure, and on the right side of the line the VOC concentration while printing with Zimpure. 
The average concentration of VOC while printing without using Zimpure is 78 ppb, When Zimpure is plugged, VOC concentration falls back to 1.38 ppb. It means that 98.2% of the VOC are filtered!

 

Our new and innovative system

Thanks to our new and innovative way to tackle the issue of 3D Printers emissions, Zimpure is compatible with all your 3D printers. You just have to choose the right suction head, depending on your printer. At this time, we have designed and tested suction heads for the most popular 3D printers (Zortrax, Ultimaker, FlashForge, MakerBot, Delta, Prusa, M3D Micro). 
   
If you a lready have an enclosure for your 3D Printer and you want to add it an effective filtering system, it's possible with Zimpure! Just plug it in through one panel and let it stick out by 1/2mm. The same is possible for a fully closed printer like Raise, Robox... 
   
We are going to design more and more suction heads. We also think that our community, using any other printer, will be able to inspire us to make it compatible with their printer. Everyone who has acquired Zimpure will be able to access the suction head 3D files on our website in order to download it and to print it! 
   
As we outlined you before, Zimpure is a very efficient filtering system. But it’s much more than that: it is also a powerful exhausting system ! 
To reach that point, Zimpure is linked to your extruder by a flexible silicone pipe. This pipe is tied to your extruder by a clipping system, by screws or by Velcro straps, depending on your printer. The suction flow is put as close as possible of the nozzle, in order to aspirate the most of the particles.

 

Antoine & Nicolas

 Nicolas: "Antoine is a fantastic Web Developer and student in Data Science. He started creating websites at 12! Deeply passionate by the Internet, he brings his web experience and knowledge to this project." 

Antoine: "Nicolas is a soul Maker. He has loved making things since his childhood. That's what led him to become an electronics engineer and a 3D Printing Lover. 3D Designer and Maker, he decided to create Zimple in order to share his work with anybody which might need it."

   

Risques et défis

We are currently running our production, and everything is going well so far. Mostly all our components are on their ways, and we will start assembling all the Zimpure within this month. 



Our tests on many different printers, representing the main configurations we can find on 3D Printers, show us our product is going to be compatible with all the 3D Printers. We have already designed and tested the suction heads for them. More are coming. We are going to move in different 3D shops and fab labs in order to design and test all the different suction heads. Furthermore, 3D printer users are often designers, engineers or makers, so we think our community is going to design new ones, even maybe improving ours. We can then share them with all the Zimple community. The designer who will make some new heads will be rewarded! 
Back us! You will not be disappointed :)

Order now at https://shop.zimple3d.com
