It’s more than 11 times higher than what we observe in a typical home, office or school ambient air. Regarding the gases: With this configuration, the predicted styrene concentration is about 150µg/m3, which is 20 times higher than the highest styrene concentration measured in commercial buildings in the U.S. That is not acceptable! In France, the particles pollution is the 3rd cause of death: more than 48 000 people die every year as a result of particles pollution. We can’t accept even more pollution inside our home!Source Some of the compounds released:   Ultrafine particles and Volatile Organic Compounds released while you're 3D printing are special: their weight is so low that they don't deal with gravity. In other words, they never fall back and remain in the air. It means that any air stream spread them through every direction. In this way, those particles are given off through the room. That's why it's really important not to let them spread by filtering them at the emission source, directly near the nozzle of your printer. This will stop the diffusion in your environment.    We also are 3D printing lovers. Nicolas, 3D Designer and Engineer, 3D printers user since many years now, was tired of always letting his window open, and of not being able to print during night. That's why he decided to develop a filtering system compatible with every 3D printer, in order to share his solution with all the 3D printers users that might need it.   After smelling the effectiveness of the prototype (once ABS smell had disappeared), we decided to improve and certify our product in order to make it reliable and manufacturable.    This emission of fumes is a global issue for 3D printers users. Some solutions exist, but our solution is unique. You don’t need to build any enclosure because our system isn't just an efficient filtering solution, it's also a powerful hoovering system that aspirates the particles and gases directly where they are produced: in the extrusion nozzle.    Zimpure is officially certified to filter 99% of the ultrafine particles and more than 90% of the gases issued by your 3D printer. It has been tested in a laboratory specialized in air pollution (CEA, LSCE department). You can access more information about the testing procedure and the complete results in our certified study report. Zimpure combines two filters:      One ultrafine particle filter, which filters 99.9% of the UFP released.      One gases filter, which filters 98% of the VOC released. Our powerful and quiet fan assures you an efficient suction flow:      More than 99% of the UFP and 90% of the gases are sucked. Ultrafine Particle Concentration without and with ZimpureThis curve was acquired by a CPC, measuring particles from 10nm diameter to 300nm. On the left side of the line you can see the UFP (UltraFine Particles) concentration while printing without Zimpure, and on the right side of the line the UFP concentration while printing with Zimpure. The average concentration of UFP while printing without using Zimpure is 373 539#/cm3. When Zimpure is plugged, the concentration falls back to 170#/cm3. It means that 99.9% of the UFP are filtered! Gases (VOC) concentration without and with Zimpure  This curve was acquired by a PTRMS, measuring VOC concentration for each atomic mass, in order to know the concentration of each different compound. On the left side of the line you can see the VOC concentration while printing without Zimpure, and on the right side of the line the VOC concentration while printing with Zimpure. The average concentration of VOC while printing without using Zimpure is 78 ppb, When Zimpure is plugged, VOC concentration falls back to 1.38 ppb. It means that 98.2% of the VOC are filtered! Our new and innovative systemThanks to our new and innovative way to tackle the issue of 3D Printers emissions, Zimpure is compatible with all your 3D printers. You just have to choose the right suction head, depending on your printer. At this time, we have designed and tested suction heads for the most popular 3D printers (Zortrax, Ultimaker, FlashForge, MakerBot, Delta, Prusa, M3D Micro).    If you a lready have an enclosure for your 3D Printer and you want to add it an effective filtering system, it's possible with Zimpure! Just plug it in through one panel and let it stick out by 1/2mm. The same is possible for a fully closed printer like Raise, Robox...    We are going to design more and more suction heads. We also think that our community, using any other printer, will be able to inspire us to make it compatible with their printer. Everyone who has acquired Zimpure will be able to access the suction head 3D files on our website in order to download it and to print it!    As we outlined you before, Zimpure is a very efficient filtering system. But it’s much more than that: it is also a powerful exhausting system ! To reach that point, Zimpure is linked to your extruder by a flexible silicone pipe. This pipe is tied to your extruder by a clipping system, by screws or by Velcro straps, depending on your printer. The suction flow is put as close as possible of the nozzle, in order to aspirate the most of the particles. Antoine & Nicolas Nicolas: "Antoine is a fantastic Web Developer and student in Data Science. He started creating websites at 12! Deeply passionate by the Internet, he brings his web experience and knowledge to this project." Antoine: "Nicolas is a soul Maker. He has loved making things since his childhood. That's what led him to become an electronics engineer and a 3D Printing Lover. 3D Designer and Maker, he decided to create Zimple in order to share his work with anybody which might need it."   Risques et défisWe are currently running our production, and everything is going well so far. Mostly all our components are on their ways, and we will start assembling all the Zimpure within this month. Our tests on many different printers, representing the main configurations we can find on 3D Printers, show us our product is going to be compatible with all the 3D Printers. We have already designed and tested the suction heads for them. More are coming. We are going to move in different 3D shops and fab labs in order to design and test all the different suction heads. Furthermore, 3D printer users are often designers, engineers or makers, so we think our community is going to design new ones, even maybe improving ours. We can then share them with all the Zimple community. The designer who will make some new heads will be rewarded! Back us! You will not be disappointed :)Order now at https://shop.zimple3d.com

story:
The AstroNematode project will be conducted by Pheronym and the USDA on the ISS NL. Karl Schiller and Dr. Fatma Kaplan are co-founders of Pheronym, bio-ag-tech pest control company that uses pheromones to control microscopic roundworms called nematodes. Dr. Kaplan discovered the first C. elegans sex pheromones which she published in Nature (2008). Then she found that other nematodes, including beneficial nematodes, use pheromones for other behaviors (PLoS 1, 2012). Karl Schiller is a seasoned entrepreneur with a background in Economics. Pheronym is his second start-up. Dr. David Shapiro-Ilan is a research scientist at the USDA. His research focuses on using beneficial nematodes for sustainable pest control.  

“The mission to space will offer a novel perspective and provide new insights into nematode behavior; the unique microgravity environment will allow us to explore fundamental mechanisms in parasitism and pathogenesis”, said Dr. Shapiro-Ilan.

Your IndieGoGo contributions will support this incredibly important research in space and on Earth.​

Mission Objectives

The AstroNematode experiment will test the effects of microgravity on the movement and infection behavior of beneficial nematodes that control a wide array of insect pests in agriculture. 

  1. To test whether beneficial nematodes produce the same pheromone composition in microgravity vs. on Earth

  2. To test whether beneficial nematodes grown in microgravity have the same symbiotic bacteria as their parents on Earth

  3. To determine whether beneficial nematodes can emerge from infected cadavers in microgravity
  4. To determine whether beneficial nematodes can disperse and forage for new insects after emergence
  5. To determine whether beneficial nematodes can infect insect hosts in microgravity
  6. To determine how microgravity affects insect host physiology

We will find out if beneficial nematodes are able to navigate through soil and infect insects, can reproduce, and if their symbiotic bacteria function normally in microgravity. We will also ascertain if the impact on insect host physiology is the same compared with what is observed on earth.

To address these questions, sealed soil columns containing nematodes and a model target pest (waxworms, Galleria mellonella) will be sent into space for 30 days. We will assess the results once the nematodes return to earth. We will conduct concurrent control experiments on Earth.

“We are looking to duplicate in space the success of our earth-bound commercialization trials of our nematode focused bio-remediation,” said Dr. Fatma Kaplan, CEO of Pheronym and the nematode space mission project director. Pheronym is an established cooperative research partner with USDA-ARS.

This is an important step toward successful extra-terrestrial agriculture. Beneficial nematodes are part of a healthy soil microbiome, which will have to be established to colonize the Moon and Mars. But this research has applications right now on Earth.

Beneficial nematodes are used for eco-friendly, non-toxic pest control. Pheronym is working with scientists at the USDA and beneficial nematode producers to use pheromones to improve beneficial nematode efficacy and reliability. Using funds from a USDA-SBIR Phase I grant, we demonstrated that we can improve beneficial nematode efficacy with pheromone pretreatment.

Results from the AstroNematode experiments could lead to improved EPN product formulations and understanding new pheromone production mechanisms. The space flight could change beneficial nematode’s effectiveness substantially. No matter what the outcomes are, the results will help us improve beneficial nematodes on Earth.

What We Need & What You Get

Your IndieGoGo contributions will support this incredibly important research in space and on Earth. We need $100,000 to pay part of our scientists’ salaries so they can prepare the experiments on Earth, transport them to Kennedy Space Center, and prepare them for launch. While the experiment is at the ISS, our scientists will be monitoring the control experiments in our Alachua, Florida lab. Then, when the experiment returns to Earth, our scientists will need to collect and analyze the data. Once the data is analyzed, it will be written up and presented in professional meetings and peer-reviewed publications. Your contributions will help our scientists do all of this.

To commemorate the achievement of this first ever experiment, Pheronym, in conjunction with the ISS National Lab and the USDA, has approved an official mission patch. Every backer will be acknowledged on the AstroNematode web site and will receive an AstroNematode Sticker to show your support. Larger backers will receive embroidered AstroNematode mission patches in addition to other perks. 

We will also host a launch party to watch the launch and broadcast the launch on Facebook live.

Whatever backing we get from your IndieGoGo contributions will help pay our scientists’ salaries. A small portion will be used to produce mission patches and stickers we will send out to you, our backers.

While we hope that we reach our goal, the mission will go on regardless. We have a $100,000 grant from the ISS National Lab that is our ticket to space. It pays for our implementation partner, NanoRacks, to send the AstroNematode experiment to the ISS and for supplies for the experiment. It also pays for a small part of our scientists’ salaries. We may have to eat a lot of ramen noodles, but we will send the AstroNematode to the ISS.

The Impact

Your support for the AstroNematode project will help improve sustainable agriculture on Earth and in Space. Nematodes are eco-friendly alternatives to broad-spectrum chemical insecticides and are also safe to humans and other nontarget organisms. Pheronym is working with scientists at the USDA and beneficial nematode producers to make beneficial nematodes better biological control with pheromones.

Using funds from a USDA-SBIR Phase I grant, we demonstrated that we can improve beneficial nematode efficacy with pheromone pretreatment. We have shared our findings with beneficial nematode producers and are working to bring our pheromone technologies to market. We are also publishing our discoveries in PLoS 1, an open access journal, so everybody can read them.

We will do the same with the discoveries from the AstroNematode project. The AstroNematode project is full of exciting science. We look forward to sharing the journey with you.

Risks & Challenges

With all scientific endeavors, there are risks and challenges. Science is about pushing the boundaries of knowledge, and this is what we do. We have over 40 years of experience studying nematodes and we are backed up by our Implementation Partner,  NanoRacks, to get the AstroNematode to the ISS National Lab and back.  

Risk Mitigation: All organisms in the study (nematodes and insects) are safe and pose no risk to humans. Potential risks:

Science

  • Beneficial nematodes may not emerge in microgravity
    • We will send beneficial nematodes in gell as a control
  • They may not forage to find a healthy insect
    • We will send infected hosts as control
  • They may lose infectivity to infect a new host
    • We will send infected hosts as control
  • They may not produce enough progeny
    • We will send beneficial nematodes in gel as a control
  • The insect hosts may not be healthy
    • We will send healthy insects as control
  • Identical experiments will be conducted on Earth as a control.

Launch

Launch delays are common in space flight. We plan to spend extra time on-site for the launch in case of delays and we will have back-up materials to put on the launch vehicle in case the delay is more than a day or two. We also have a lab in Alachua, Florida, which is a 2 ½ hour drive from Kennedy Space Center. Fresh supplies can be brought from our lab if needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t back AstroNematode, there are other ways you can help. Get the word out about AstroNematode. Like and follow @astronematode on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and Linkedin and share it with all your friends and followers. Don’t forget to use the IndieGoGo sharing tools. We want as many people as possible to know about this project and the awesome science we are doing on the International Space Station.

story:
At Gomi, we're always looking for new ways that we can create positive impact through design products that rethink waste and help clean up our beautiful planet. This is what led to creating the Gomi Portable Charger - An environmentally-friendly 12,000mAh Portable Charger made from 100% non-recyclable plastic, with 100% of the power coming from repurposed batteries saved from otherwise going to landfill.

We are also offering a free return service to ensure the chargers are fully recycled at the end of life.

 

​

 

All of our battery cells are taken from local manufacturers who can no longer use the batteries within their products, due to misprints or irregularities. We work with the battery suppliers to take any stock that cannot be used in their products, and would otherwise be sent as waste with regular post-consumer batteries. All of the cells we use are tested to ensure that they are high-performance, safe, and are durable to last long periods of time in the chargers.

Battery waste is a growing issue worldwide, currently over 3 billion batteries are produced every year with no real way to recycle or reuse them in commercial products. With global demand for li-ion batteries forecasted to grow 10% a year from 2020-25, the waste pile of batteries will carry on getting bigger. If electric and hybrid vehicles are removed from the forecast, the number falls to just 4% per year. We are pushing hard to work with electric car manufacturers to ensure that their batteries has a second life. They hope to release portable chargers made from electric car batteries later in the year too.

 

Plastic waste makes up 85% of the pollution on our beaches around the world, and every year the UK alone throws away 1.2 billion kilos of flexible plastics. Worldwide, 150 billion kilos of flexible plastics are produced every year. Flexible plastic (LDPE) consists of plastic bags, bubble wrap and pallet wrap, which are all not accepted by UK councils for recycling.

At Gomi, we tap into these specific waste streams, and transform it from a pollutant waste into high-powered everyday Portable Chargers.

We work closely with food wholesalers, businesses and individuals in and around Brighton, to recycle all of the plastic packaging waste - intercepting it before it's sent to incineration or landfill. We also accept plastic waste from local households and businesses and celebrate the mix of colours we get from the different waste streams. 

We start every project with one clear question - How can we turn pollutant waste materials into cherished products that people will love using every day? And began with these basic principles when designing the Portable Chargers:

  • Big enough to hold enough battery power to keep you charged for long periods without charge, but slim enough to fit in your pocket.
  • Beautiful, with each one being an original work of art. This emotionally durable relationship people have with their objects can be enhanced through owning something truly individual.
  • Simple to manufacture in-house in our Brighton workspace, which would benefit the local economy and avoid any long-distance outsourcing which would add to the carbon footprint of the product.
  • Easy to disassemble back into raw materials after use, to be easily upcycled into new future products.

We have a free return service for recycling - with all the parts designed to be modular, and easily separated so that they can be melted into new components for future products - without losing any material value. We also aim to recycle all of the circuit boards and are planning to work with jewellers who extract the valuable metals from the boards to be given another life.

story:
You can now order your Dolfi!

Since we launched our campaign in 2015, the journey from a working lab prototype to a real manufactured product has been long and super challenging. We went through several major supplier changes, dozens of design adjustments, hundreds of technical challenges, but we made it!!!

In October 2017, we shipped the first units to beta testers and in December 2017 we shipped the first small batch to our IGG campaign backers. Since then our production is running, we have shipped thousands of devices to our backers and we continue working on ramping up the output.

Due to high demand, the current delivery time for new orders is about 4-6 weeks. 

The Original Dolfi Device includes:

The Dolfi device

Interchangeable plug type A (US, China)

Interchangeable plug type C (EU)

If you intend to use your Dolfi device in UK, AU, HK or other countries with G and I type power outlets please consider to order set with appropriate power plugs.

click here to buy Dolfi

All 1000 devices from this limited sales offer will be shipped before May 31st 2018.

click here to order your Dolfi

 

 

 

Remember those great delicate pieces of fashion hopelessly ruined by machine wash? Dolfi is the next generation cleaning technology: it's gentle on clothes, but tough on dirt.  Your favorites will be thoroughly cleaned from inside out with the power of ultrasound without any damage.

and they will look like new wash, after wash, after wash....

Staying fresh while traveling is challenging. You either risk going over baggage limits with excess clothing, pay heavily for laundry service, or waste time searching for coin laundries. Don't like any of these options? Travel with Dolfi!

 

 

                                 Dolfi is great for

 

Dolfi is great for everything you would normally hesitate to throw into a washing machine! With Dolfi, “Handwash Only” labels no longer apply.
 


Dolfi isn’t just a pretty package - this compact but powerful device consumes about 80 times less energy than a conventional washing machine, helping you make a huge positive impact for the planet and, of course, for your wallet.

 

                     Save on every wash with Dolfi

 

With Dolfi you can save on dry cleaning cost for delicates, on hotel or laundry services while you're traveling and on overweight charges on your luggage from packing extra clothing.

You can have peace of mind knowing that your favorite delicates won't be ruined and that you won't run out of fresh clothes on your travels. With Dolfi, you can buy any kind of fashion you like and not worry about the "Hand wash only" label.

 

           How does it work? It's amazingly simple...

Put your clothes in waterproof container, add water, detergent and Dolfi. Switch the device on and enjoy your free time!

 

The device will glow blue as it softly cleans your clothes. Blue light indicates ultrasound vibrations in the water. It works like magic!

After only 30-40 min, your clothes will be fresh and clean. Rinse them and hang to dry – you can wear your favorites again the next morning!

Dolfi is silent when working, so you wash during late hours without disturbing even the lightest of sleepers.

 

Need to run out the door while Dolfi’s working?– No worries. It’s completely safe to leave the Dolfi on past the standard cycle. In fact, doing so can even improve the washing results.

 

                                Does it really work?

Ultrasonic cleaning has been successfully used in industry and medical practices for years. Materials that require thorough but delicate cleaning, such as dental and surgical instruments, lenses, jewelry, watches and much more, trust only the ultrasonic touch. In industry, ultrasonic technology is applied to remove oil and grease from motors and other automotive parts. For years, ultrasonic cleaning has continuously proven to be highly effective and efficient.

Here you can see the results that we achieved with our functional prototype:

 

                                The Technology

 

''If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration''   Nikola Tesla 

 

Dolfi’s powerful multi-frequency transducer creates precisely modulated wideband progressive sound waves, which travel through water and form microscopic high-pressure bubbles. The tiny bubbles then implode, creating millions of micro-jet liquid streams. Those invisible yet powerful streams safely wash away all dirt from fabric

 

 

                 Dolfi philosophy and your impact

We believe that the best technologies have their roots in nature.
Inspired by amazing benefits of ultrasound, successfully utilized for years in many industrial and medical applications, we’re passionate about redefining the ultrasonic technology for everyday consumer use.

With your help we can bring to the world a device that can fundamentally change the way we wash.

 

Dolfi’s name is a tribute to dolphins, the most advanced users of ultrasound and one of the most intelligent animals on our planet. Part of the campaign funds will go towards dolphin research and welfare.We’ll inform you in campaign updates about those projects.

 

You can make a real difference by backing the Dolfi project!

 

               Where we are now and what's next

After months of engineering development and testing we now have a highly functional and performing lab prototype. Currently we're working closely with the factory manufacturers to prepare the production setup, and finalize materials and components for the mass manufacturing.

 

 

 And here is our Team in the factory:

 

 

                  Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

 

Help! What if I forgot to pay for shipping?

No problem. If you're outside the US and forgot to pay your shipping, simply order the International Shipping perk. Just make sure to enter the same personal information you provided with your initial order. We will do the matching ourselves at the end of the campaign.

 

Am I supposed to manually add shipping if I'm not in the US?

Yes, you have to add shipping on top of your selected perk. When you pledge, add the shipping amount indicated in your perk as an "additional gift" or simply order the International Shipping perk with the same personal information.

 

How much laundry can I wash in one load?

We recommend washing about 1-2kg of laundry. It should float freely in the water during the washing cycle.

 

Have you tested it, will it really work?
 

It does sound a little like magic… Ultrasonic cleaning has been around for decades already and it's successfully applied for cleaning of wide range of items from surgical instruments up to watches, jewelry and automotive parts. The engineers from MPI Ultrasonics applied their over 25 years of experience in order to come up with Dolfi's technological solution for textiles. For many months they were developing, testing, and improving the performance of device until our lab prototype achieved the desired results. Our latest units demonstrate impressive performances in the laboratory tests.

 

I am concerned about putting a plug-in device in the water… Isn’t that dangerous?

Not more dangerous than jumping into a swimming pool, nicely lightened with high voltage bulbs. Dolfi is developed in compliance with highest international standards on electric devices operating in water. We will certify Dolfi in accordance to region specific safety requirements: UL for US and Canada; CE for Europe; PSE for Japan; CCC for China etc. We’ll also complete an IPX68 (water submersion) test for Dolfi before shipping it to customers.

 

Can Dolfi replace my automatic washing machine?

No. Dolfi is not a full cycle washing machine, it does only the washing part. It will also not be effective for big loads of laundry and for voluminous pieces such as bed linen, towels, jeans etc. Dolfi will rather complement your washing machine to deal with small volumes of delicate items that require a sensitive wash and can be ruined in the machine.

 

How about the smell, will Dolfi refresh my clothes or just clean them?

The washing process with Dolfi efficiently removes dirt and odors. You clothes will be ultrafresh after ultrasonic cleaning.

 

Do I need a detergent to wash with Dolfi?

Yes, you do. Over the last decades there were several attempts to develop ultrasonic washers which work without the detergent, but with Dolfi we didn't take this path. It might be the next challenge for our engineers.

 

What kind of detergent is recommended to wash with Dolfi?

You can use any type of washing detergent available on the market. It doesn't matter if it's a liquid or powder. The better the quality of detergent, the better the results of washing.

 

What's about rinsing and drying?

Dolfi performs only the washing part, you'll have to rinse and dry manually. Careful approach to drying also prolongs the life of your delicates. Your silk, lingerie, and knits will surely look much better if you carefully hang them, rather than heat them up with the hot air in the dryer.

 

I don’t mind doing hand wash. What can Dolfi do for me?

Dolfi has no mechanical impact on your washing. Rubbing your clothes between your hands can damage the structure or even rip the fabric. If you wash with Dolfi, your clothing will not wear out  during the washing process.

 

Can I use it with 110V or is it 220V only?

Dolfi was designed for travelers. You can use it with any power supply from around the world.

 

Will it discolor my clothes?

No. Dolfi preserves your clothes’ color. Just make sure not to use color aggressive detergent.

 

What else do I need to make Dolfi work?

You only need a waterproof container (or even a plastic bag), a small amount of detergent, a power source, and of course, your Dolfi device.

 

What is the difference between Dolfi and a washing machine in regards to the quality of washing?

Dolfi cleans your clothes gently, rather than banging them against the drum walls. The microscopic cavitation bubbles are also capable of reaching micro capillary fibers of fabric which is impossible to do with washing machines. The washing results are about the same, but Dolfi treats your clothing much more carefully.

 

What is ultrasonic technology?

Ultrasound is an oscillating sound pressure wave with a frequency greater than the limits of human hearing range. But even though we can't hear it, those sound waves are very powerful, think of dolphins communicating with one another from miles away. Specific frequency ultrasound waves in the water trigger a process called, cavitation.

 

Does ultrasonic cleaning work for textiles?

Ultrasonic technology is widely used for precise cleaning in industry and medicine – watches, jewelry, surgical instruments, medical implants, automotive parts and much more. High frequency waves perform superbly on hard materials and complete the cleaning process with remarkable results within just few minutes . But it's a difference for textile and other soft materials. In order to achieve good cleaning results on textiles, the wave frequency has to be modulated differently and the cleaning time extended. However, despite the challenges, ultrasonic cleaning for textile has been applied with standard size washing machines by companies such Sanyo and Sharp more than a decade ago. Another kind of ultrasonic textile cleaning has been developed for industrial applications by the German company, Sonotronic. The recent scientific research from Japan proves the efficiency of ultrasound cleaning on textiles.

 

I'm a member of the press, how do I contact you?

You can contact us by sending an email to lena@dolfi.co Our press release and media kit with hi-res pictures can be found here.

 

Who made your video?

Our crowdfunding video was made by London, UK based crowdfunding agency Wow Your Crowd (https://wowyourcrowd.co.uk/)

 

Are you hiring? Can I join the Dolfi Team?

As a startup company we are on the growth path and if you think you can contribute to Dolfi development with your talent, skills, and experience, we welcome you to apply with a short message to jobs@dolfi.co. Write us why you think you're a good fit for the Dolfi Team.

 

We’ll be happy to answer your specific questions about Dolfi and its technology, just email us info@dolfi.co
story_txt:
You can now order your Dolfi!Since we launched our campaign in 2015, the journey from a working lab prototype to a real manufactured product has been long and super challenging. We went through several major supplier changes, dozens of design adjustments, hundreds of technical challenges, but we made it!!!In October 2017, we shipped the first units to beta testers and in December 2017 we shipped the first small batch to our IGG campaign backers. Since then our production is running, we have shipped thousands of devices to our backers and we continue working on ramping up the output.Due to high demand, the current delivery time for new orders is about 4-6 weeks. The Original Dolfi Device includes:The Dolfi deviceInterchangeable plug type A (US, China)Interchangeable plug type C (EU)If you intend to use your Dolfi device in UK, AU, HK or other countries with G and I type power outlets please consider to order set with appropriate power plugs.click here to buy DolfiAll 1000 devices from this limited sales offer will be shipped before May 31st 2018.click here to order your Dolfi

 
 

 
Remember those great delicate pieces of fashion hopelessly ruined by machine wash? Dolfi is the next generation cleaning technology: it's gentle on clothes, but tough on dirt.  Your favorites will be thoroughly cleaned from inside out with the power of ultrasound without any damage.
and they will look like new wash, after wash, after wash....Staying fresh while traveling is challenging. You either risk going over baggage limits with excess clothing, pay heavily for laundry service, or waste time searching for coin laundries. Don't like any of these options? Travel with Dolfi!
 
 
                                 Dolfi is great for
 
Dolfi is great for everything you would normally hesitate to throw into a washing machine! With Dolfi, “Handwash Only” labels no longer apply. 
Dolfi isn’t just a pretty package - this compact but powerful device consumes about 80 times less energy than a conventional washing machine, helping you make a huge positive impact for the planet and, of course, for your wallet.                      Save on every wash with Dolfi With Dolfi you can save on dry cleaning cost for delicates, on hotel or laundry services while you're traveling and on overweight charges on your luggage from packing extra clothing.You can have peace of mind knowing that your favorite delicates won't be ruined and that you won't run out of fresh clothes on your travels. With Dolfi, you can buy any kind of fashion you like and not worry about the "Hand wash only" label.
 
           How does it work? It's amazingly simple...
Put your clothes in waterproof container, add water, detergent and Dolfi. Switch the device on and enjoy your free time!
 

The device will glow blue as it softly cleans your clothes. Blue light indicates ultrasound vibrations in the water. It works like magic!
After only 30-40 min, your clothes will be fresh and clean. Rinse them and hang to dry – you can wear your favorites again the next morning!
Dolfi is silent when working, so you wash during late hours without disturbing even the lightest of sleepers.
 Need to run out the door while Dolfi’s working?– No worries. It’s completely safe to leave the Dolfi on past the standard cycle. In fact, doing so can even improve the washing results. 

                                Does it really work?
Ultrasonic cleaning has been successfully used in industry and medical practices for years. Materials that require thorough but delicate cleaning, such as dental and surgical instruments, lenses, jewelry, watches and much more, trust only the ultrasonic touch. In industry, ultrasonic technology is applied to remove oil and grease from motors and other automotive parts. For years, ultrasonic cleaning has continuously proven to be highly effective and efficient.

Here you can see the results that we achieved with our functional prototype:

 

                                The Technology

 
''If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration''   Nikola Tesla 
 
Dolfi’s powerful multi-frequency transducer creates precisely modulated wideband progressive sound waves, which travel through water and form microscopic high-pressure bubbles. The tiny bubbles then implode, creating millions of micro-jet liquid streams. Those invisible yet powerful streams safely wash away all dirt from fabric
   
                 Dolfi philosophy and your impact
We believe that the best technologies have their roots in nature.Inspired by amazing benefits of ultrasound, successfully utilized for years in many industrial and medical applications, we’re passionate about redefining the ultrasonic technology for everyday consumer use.
With your help we can bring to the world a device that can fundamentally change the way we wash.
 
Dolfi’s name is a tribute to dolphins, the most advanced users of ultrasound and one of the most intelligent animals on our planet. Part of the campaign funds will go towards dolphin research and welfare.We’ll inform you in campaign updates about those projects.

 
You can make a real difference by backing the Dolfi project!
 

               Where we are now and what's next
After months of engineering development and testing we now have a highly functional and performing lab prototype. Currently we're working closely with the factory manufacturers to prepare the production setup, and finalize materials and components for the mass manufacturing.

story:
SUMMARY OF MR COURTNEY BAILEY

 

My name is Courtney Bailey and I am the Chairman of the Finsbury Park Business Forum which is also the local Chambers of Commerce here in Finsbury Park, London. The Business Forum also runs a program called The Business and Community Wardens, The Wardens work side by side with the Metropolitan Police and British Transport Police. The Programme is supported by the Leader of Islington Council: Catherine West, by Jeremy Corbyn(MP), London Buses, London Underground and other bodies and organisations. www.finsburyparkbusinessforum.co.uk 

I am also the Church Warden for three Anglican Churches in the Tollington Parish: www.tollingtonparish.org.uk., and am also a Director of the Richard Cloudsley Charity:www.richardcloudsleycharity.org.uk, which started in 1518 and is one of the oldest Charities in the world. This Charity has given out millions of pounds to the poor and unfortunate across five centuries.

I am very passionate about the environment and about how we generate electricity. Generating electricity should be clean, sustainable and affordable. Energy prices are very expensive at the moment, causing people to cut back because they cannot afford it.

Contributor’s will facilitate the building of the Prototype thereby reducing reliance on coal and other highly polluting forms of energy.     

 

                               WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

 

We need £1,300,000

This Fund will be used for building the Prototype, renting an office, paying staff and getting the Generator on the  market.

 

Each contributor will be given free shares equivalent to the value of their contribution. For example: if you contribute £25 you will receive twenty five shares. These shares, at pre-production prices are valued at £1, but will be expected to rise considerably once the Generator is on the Market. Additionally, we are offering a discount on future electricity bills, which will be extended to about five years.

 

The Fund will go more to producing the Prototype than acquiring an office if we do not reach our entire goal.

 

 

 

We believe that the general public are, for the most part, concerned about the implications of global warming and desire a strongly proactive stance in combating it, despite demurrals from both sides of the argument. We also believe in a progressive philosophy: a world that can be steadily improved  not only through technology, but also through the ability to use that technology wisely; which means being able to judge between what is harmful and what is beneficial. This isn’t always easy, of course. No-one can really judge the impact of a particular technology until it is utilised.

        Some technologies are, however, unambiguously beneficial: a technology, for example, that requires no extraneous source of fuel and has no foreseeable impact on the environment, and that offers a cheap and effective means of generating energy. And what we have just described is what we have here in the Kinmech Generator. This is technology that is clean, effective and progressive. A technology with which to confront the future with hope and optimism.

          Every technological development is a product of its inventor or inventors, and insofar as each innovation builds upon or is developed from existing technology, it is also born in the mind of the inventor, some of whom are Corporately funded, but many, conversely, who work alone to achieve a particular vision across many years, perhaps decades, and who follow their instincts and motivations unaided and unsponsored because they believe in the worth and eventual application of their invention. It is a difficult and solitary path for these lone mavericks and often they find it very difficult to engender interest or funding. This is why many innovations die unknown and unlauded, unable as they are to fully blossom into being, remaining only as ephemeral might-have-been’s. This seems to be the sad fact in Great Britain, a country renowned world-wide for its many innovations and inventions across many fields. Due to lack of interest and funding these innovations and inventions are taken abroad where they often find a more sympathetic hearing. Frank Whittle, inventor of the Jet Engine, and Dyson who invented the bagless hoover, are classic examples of such short-sightedness, This Generator is unashamedly British and we strongly hope that it remains so. With your help we believe that it can    

 

                                                  THE IMPACT                 

By contributing to this Fund you will be playing your part in the reduction of our reliance on Coal and Fossil Fuels, and you would also gain financially through the receipt of shares and discounts on future electricity generation once the Generator is on the Market.

I consider myself to be very honest in the way I deal or do business with people and I want all those who contribute to have regular updates on the progress of the Generator.

 

                                                      OTHER

 

If you are unable to contribute please tell your family, friends and the world about this new technology, and please use the INDIEGOGO share tools.

 

Our technology is innovation at its best,with over nine patents filed. It is named:KINMECH ENVIRONMENTAL ELECTRIC GENERATOR,based on the water wheel principle of rotation by which one side of the wheel is always heavier than the the other, causing the wheel to continually spin. The wheel consists of sixteen(16)arms, of which eight(8 contain a projectile,causing the rightward rotation of the wheel due to a crossover in the middle of the device, which allows the projectile to come out of one arm and immediately re-enters another, resulting in the right-ward rotation (spin)of the wheel.Based on the water wheel principle,our scenario replaces the water with a projectile.The projectile weight ratio eliminates equilibrium, thereby allowing the wheel to spin right-wards,and when attached to our turbine produces electricity. Eight(8)of the arms are primed and upon the release of the brake induces the wheel to spin.Each of the arms passes through a gate and a trigger is pulled back, releasing the projectile upwards. The gate-system is one way, which allows the upward movement of the projectile whilst preventing the downward movement of the same. On the down cycle the gate is kept open by two pistons, one on each side of the gate. The amount of energy generated will start from 15,000 watts to well above one megawatt. The Generator provides a bridge between conventional technology and future means of economically generating electricity. 

 

In our modern world it is imperative that we consider new forms of technology that can be utilized to confront and combat the many problems that afflict the environment. In the future, if nothing is done, energy prices will become unaffordable to many people.Without action to combat pollution and global warming many parts of the planet will become uninhabitable and the present catalog of droughts, tsunami's and freak weather patterns will to continue to worsen.
We must, as a species, be made to realize the impact and harm we wreak on the biosphere and be able to recognise the need for cleaner forms of energy production. The revolution is beginning slowly, but as they say:from small acorns great acorns grow. What we have here, in the Generator, is one of those acorns. Please help us nurture so that eventually it will grow into one of those mighty oaks, and from that oak a forest will spring.

 Help us to build a generator fit for the 21st Centry.

story:
Short Summary

Plate Technologies is a team of four undergraduate students at the University of Rochester who are competing in the Hult Prize, the world’s largest social entrepreneurship challenge for college students. Our team is made up of Dilshawn Gamage, Annamarie Forestiere, Nicholas Cheng, and Chase Lindemann; together we will be traveling to Dubai in March to compete in the regional level of the Hult Prize, for a chance to win one million dollars to fund our business and help us change the lives of people around the world. Our mission is to create cleaner and safer alternatives to open-flame cooking, a practice that kills millions each year. With help from contributors like you, we hope to be well prepared for this stage in the competition next month.  

What We Need

Our team needs funding to cover conference expenses and to help us develop as much of our social enterprise as possible before the competition. We are asking for $4,250, and we believe that if we can reach our goal, we stand a great chance of advancing to the semi-finals. The funding received from our contributors will go toward conference expenses, such as lodging in Dubai; it will also go toward business expenses, such as the development of a prototype of our product and marketing and promotional costs. As the first place team representing the University of Rochester in this level of the Hult Prize, we want to make our University, contributors, family members, advisers, and friends. proud - we need your help to make that happen!

The Impact

If we reach our funding goal, we will be able to develop a product and a business that will change the way people around the world view cooking. We hope to create a safer alternative to current cooking methods, which will prevent deaths due to smoke inhalation caused by open flame cooking. The Hult Prize provides Plate Technologies with an excellent platform to receive the support and guidance we need to turn our idea into reality, and with the help of contributors like you, our team can make the most of this incredible opportunity in March.We have already made it this far - you can help us go even further.  

Risks & Challenges

Our team knows that this competition is a big risk in and of itself; we will be competing against 60 teams, and only one team from Dubai will advance to the semi-finals. That’s why we need your help! If we are able to develop a working prototype before the competition, we will be an extremely competitive team, and have a good chance of being that top team. The four of us also realize that starting a business is a huge risk. To combat that risk, we are working with some of the best entrepreneurial minds that the University of Rochester has to offer. By receiving guidance from our advisers, and with the help we hope to receive from people like you, we are confident in our ability to make our idea work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t financially contribute, we would still love your help! If you know any entrepreneurs who have successfully started a business, or if you yourself have done so, we are always looking for advice that can help us start our enterprise. You can also share this link on your social media page - the more people who know what we are trying to do, the more likely we are to reach our goals!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Plate Technologies is a team of four undergraduate students at the University of Rochester who are competing in the Hult Prize, the world’s largest social entrepreneurship challenge for college students. Our team is made up of Dilshawn Gamage, Annamarie Forestiere, Nicholas Cheng, and Chase Lindemann; together we will be traveling to Dubai in March to compete in the regional level of the Hult Prize, for a chance to win one million dollars to fund our business and help us change the lives of people around the world. Our mission is to create cleaner and safer alternatives to open-flame cooking, a practice that kills millions each year. With help from contributors like you, we hope to be well prepared for this stage in the competition next month.  

What We Need
Our team needs funding to cover conference expenses and to help us develop as much of our social enterprise as possible before the competition. We are asking for $4,250, and we believe that if we can reach our goal, we stand a great chance of advancing to the semi-finals. The funding received from our contributors will go toward conference expenses, such as lodging in Dubai; it will also go toward business expenses, such as the development of a prototype of our product and marketing and promotional costs. As the first place team representing the University of Rochester in this level of the Hult Prize, we want to make our University, contributors, family members, advisers, and friends. proud - we need your help to make that happen!

The Impact
If we reach our funding goal, we will be able to develop a product and a business that will change the way people around the world view cooking. We hope to create a safer alternative to current cooking methods, which will prevent deaths due to smoke inhalation caused by open flame cooking. The Hult Prize provides Plate Technologies with an excellent platform to receive the support and guidance we need to turn our idea into reality, and with the help of contributors like you, our team can make the most of this incredible opportunity in March.We have already made it this far - you can help us go even further.  

Risks & Challenges
Our team knows that this competition is a big risk in and of itself; we will be competing against 60 teams, and only one team from Dubai will advance to the semi-finals. That’s why we need your help! If we are able to develop a working prototype before the competition, we will be an extremely competitive team, and have a good chance of being that top team. The four of us also realize that starting a business is a huge risk. To combat that risk, we are working with some of the best entrepreneurial minds that the University of Rochester has to offer. By receiving guidance from our advisers, and with the help we hope to receive from people like you, we are confident in our ability to make our idea work.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t financially contribute, we would still love your help! If you know any entrepreneurs who have successfully started a business, or if you yourself have done so, we are always looking for advice that can help us start our enterprise. You can also share this link on your social media page - the more people who know what we are trying to do, the more likely we are to reach our goals!

story:
Meet Remo, the Universal Smart Controller for Room ACs

 

 

 

Award

 

 

What Can Remo Do?

 

Remo mobile app tracks your geo-location allowing us to automatically turn on your AC before you get home, and turn off your AC when nobody is present in a particular room. Remo's location awareness allows you to arrive at a cool home and at the same time you get to avoid cooling empty rooms.

 

 

 

 

Works with ANY AC

Compatible with any AC

Remo currently supports any AC with a IR remote control. 

 

 

 

AC Compatibility & Remote Database

Remo works with AC brands from all over the world, including those popular in North American, Europe, Japan, and other countries.

 

 

No Wires, No Screws, and Pre-programmed for your AC 

Start using Remo just by connecting to home WiFi. No wires, no screws, and its pre-programmed to communicate with existing ACs.

 

 

 

 

How it Works

Remo uses infrared commands to communicate with existing ACs.

 

 

What Inspires Nature to Create Remo

 

 

Nature develops solutions to create harmony between people and nature. Nature's current focus is improving residential energy management with intelligent AC control and peak energy management. 

A century ago, the Industrial Revolution radically changed the way humans interact with the earth. As the world economy grows, we are approaching the limits of natural systems to accommodate our needs. At Nature, we believe that we can deliver superior services to society and reduce stress on the environment simultaneously. In other words, we make products that improve people's lives AND the world that they live in.

 

 

Who We Are

Founding Members

 

 

Haruumi Shiode / Founder and CEO

Haruumi holds an MBA from Harvard Business School. Prior to HBS, Haruumi worked for Mitsui ＆ Co., investing in Silicon Valley start-up and large scale, international power plants. Haruumi also earned his Masters in Computer Science at KTH in Sweden, and his Bachelors in Electronics in Japan. He developed his first computer program, similar to Space Invader, in 7th grade.

Mash Ohtsuka / Founder and CTO

Mash independently developed “IRKit”, an open source smart IR controller which sold nearly 10,000 units. Prior to IRKit, Mash worked for Panasonic, and designed & developed a number of successful web services at Kayac (web service producer in Japan), including “Koebu”, “lobi”, “wonderful”, and “jsdo.it”. Mash earned his Bachelors in Computer Science in Japan.

Other Members

  • Industrial Design / Tomomi Nagao
  • Hardware Engineering / Naohiro Iida
  • Software Engineering / Nao Iizuka
  • Mobile App Design / Kazuhiro Hashimoto
  • Package Design / Tomoya Sasaki 
  • Mechanical Design / Kuniaki Sento
  • Video Creation (except for interview part) / Philip Giancola & Carol Kim
  • PR Consultant / BIGfish

 

 

Technical Specs

Nature Remo Controller:

 

It intelligently controls your AC through infrared, powered via the accompanying wall plug.

 

 

 

Open API / Integrations

Nature will grant access to Nature Remo’s API so developers can program Nature Remo to interact with other IoT devices. Moreover, Nature will provide IFTTT (If This Then That), and Amazon Alexa integrations.

 

 

These integrations will open up your Remo and your AC to a new world of possibilities. Remo and IFTTT will enable you to control your AC using a triggering event such as Android/iPhone location updates, predefined schedules, and even through SMS, Twitter, and Facebook, and 300+ other services. The possibilities are endless.

 

 

 

What’s in the box? 

  • 1x Nature Remo Controller 
  • 1x USB wall plug (US/JP/EU/AU Type)
  • 1x USB cable (6.56 feet/2 meters)

 

 

Project Schedule

December 2014 – Built concept and founded company 

August 2015 – Built first prototype with IRKit 

February 2016 – Built second prototype with own PCB 

April 2016 – Finalized hardware design 

May 2016 – Launch Kickstarter campaign and refine firmware 

June 2016 – Kickstarter campaign ends,  refine mobile app, and order components

January 2017 – Production starts, obtain certifications for Remo Controller (FCC) 

May 2017 – Delivery to the Indiegogo customers 

 

 

 Press Kit for Nature Remo

 

 

Risk and Challenges

 

AC Remotes 

In order to make the Nature Remo device simple to set up, we are putting in countless hours to build up our own database of remote controllers. While our custom in-house solution is designed to identify your AC remote with the push of just a couple of buttons, there is a possibility that some specific model may need additional infrared codes. If this issue arises, we may need you to manually set up those codes.

Smart Phone 

Another aspect is the diverse quantity of smartphones around the world. If phone is a recent model, produced by a known manufacturer, there will be no issues using our app. However, there is a slight possibility that some specific model might need some changes in the code. We will do our best to address these issues as quickly as possible, as they come to our attention. Any feedback is highly appreciated.

Production of Hardware 

During the last months we have worked extensively on research and testing of all aspects around the PCB board and its enclosure. One challenge we might face are unforeseeable issues arising from suppliers not meeting their projected lead times for selected components.

story:
Daydreaming

In 2014, I studied permaculture in Zaytuna Farm NSW. I fell into a daydream on that day as the  weather was extremely hot while my teacher taught about sustainable energy. A key sentence went through my ears while I was still daydreaming. “ You can harvest tree branches and sticks from your backyard for firewood fuel without logging whole trees down”

“ Wow, what a wonderful idea, I never thought about that, but what was that?” “Can’t hear very clear... just heard something.....Stove,” the voice talked to me in my daydream.

As time went by, in recent years, our family moved into a newly built house with a central heating system and we have only used it for a couple of weeks. By this time, the gas meter has already shown the cost of the next gas bill will be around two thousand dollars according to our gas usage.

After that, we started to think of installing a new wood heater but none of the wood heaters on the market satisfied our inquiries.

I started to check my Permaculture Design Course Manual. Something about stoves not needing to cut entire trees down for firewood, just gather twigs or sticks? Finally I found that these are called “Rocket Stoves.”

It was very exciting and I read it again and again, searching the internet day and night.

I found out it could not fit in my house because a rocket stove is mainly used for cooking not for heating and a rocket mass heater is only built on building sites, it can not be produced in a factory meaning we could not buy one from stores or the online market.

 

I still liked that idea. “Not needing to cut entire trees down, you can harvest tree branches year after year.”

Where can I get similar products? One day I drove to my friend's place and an idea sprouted from my mind. “Yes,” it can be designed that way.

I decided to invite two friends of mine to join my research in how a wood heater works and produce an invention for highly efficient wood combustion in a heater. Finally, we managed to invent a prototype of our Rocket Math Heater.

Daydreaming is a Sign of Intelligence, New Studies Say.

 

Rocket Math Heater

The biggest innovation in the wood heater in 200 years

 

Rocket Math Heater relates generally to an improved wood combustion heater. The method of wood combustion has been changed and is more efficient and sustainable.

A Rocket Math Heater offers almost the complete combustion of the wood. When wood is burned it releases volatile gases that we recognise as creosote or smoke and the Rocket Math Heater sucks these volatile gases into combustion tunnels and a combustion firebox of the unit where they combust. This action is known as the secondary combustion and it releases even more heat energy to power the ‘rocket’ process.

The remarkable sucking of the flames down into the firebox resulting in a 'roar' is what gives the rocket stoves their name. 

The Rocket Math Heater combustion system is very cheap to run. The combustion area only burns the bottom of the feed tubes and as the wood burns vertically, only a small portion of wood is burnt at a time. They offer the almost complete combustion of wood, meaning they are hyper-efficient and burn super-clean and they can reach very high temperatures while only using small and medium diameters of timber. There would be no need to cut whole trees down, we could just harvest tree branches year after year. This way, we can save millions, potentially billions of trees.

 

 

Rocket Math Heater vs Conventional Heater

The main difference between a normal wood heater and a Rocket Math Heater is that the rocket combustion is close to complete. When wood is burned it releases volatile compounds that we recognise as smoke, soot or creosote. In a Rocket Math Heater these compounds are sucked into combustion tunnels and a combustion firebox of the unit where they combust, releasing even more heat energy to drive the ‘rocket’ process, unlike a normal wood heater where they are blown out of the chimney.

Rocket Math Heaters are improved by an operable auxiliary combustion chamber coupled to the main combustion chamber. The auxiliary combustion may further comprise an air supply conduit supplying air beneath the fuel chute, allowing lots of oxygen to be drawn into the unit. As the fire starts, and the burn tunnel heats up, the rising hot air races up the combustion chamber, drawing lots of air behind it. This incoming air flows into the feed tube and across the burning wood, creating the same effect as pointing a big air-blower at your fire. It gets really hot while the wood burns beautifully, and you can hear the air roaring as it charges through the system.

In conventional wood stoves the air intake is small and adjustable to make them even smaller. This lack of oxygen chokes the combustion, leading to cool burns, incomplete combustion and lots of smoke and creosote. When combustion is complete, what comes out the chimney is pretty much only carbon dioxide, meaning no smoke: smoke means incomplete combustion, unburnt fuel or wasted energy. We are culturally trained to associate smoke with fire but with Rocket Math Heaters, where there is no smoke, there is still fire!

Having ensured there is complete combustion and maximum heat generation, we then think about using wood heaters.

Conventional wood heaters suck heat away from the combustion chamber for cooking and space heating but with ‘wet back’ water heaters, the unit just can’t get hot enough for combustion to be complete, resulting in lots of smoke.

That is how a Rocket Math Heater differs from normal wood heater.

 *The picture show smoke from a conventional wood heater.

Rocket Math Heater vs Rocket stove and Rocket mass heater

The Rocket Math Heater is different from Rocket stoves and Rocket mass heaters because Rocket stoves are too small to heat a large space and Rocket mass heaters can heat large spaces but can not be manufactured and has to be built on a building site. The Rocket Math heater is able to be manufactured and also able to heat a large space. The Rocket Math Heater is basically an all in one combustion system.

You and me can help save billions of trees from the wood fuel plantations, but keep wood industry jobs because medium sizes of wood requires more labor to split but requires less cutting down of trees and trees to not be cut down.

 

Costs of action and inaction, which is the smart way?

The NSW EPA reported that the additional health costs attributable to the impact of wood smoke by 2030 could be up to $8 billion in NSW alone. In addition to the economic costs associated with wood smoke there are the impacts on individuals to consider. Costs of action and inaction, which is the smart way?

We need action before it’s too late.

 

The Rocket Math Heater offer complete combustion, what comes out the chimney is pretty much only steam, meaning no smoke.

 

The story of a cockatoo can save billions of trees.

A cockatoo tried to put out a bush fire with her wings by dampening them in the river. She flew ten thousand times in and out from the river to the fire, all day and night.

Her heroic gesture touched one of the great angels from heaven.

The angel came to the fire and asked her “How come you can put out the bush fire with just a few drops from your wings each time you carried from the river?

“In this stage, this is the only way I can put out the fire, if you have a better way, please do it, or I will have to go before the fire takes over and it will be too late!” The cockatoo answered.

The great angel was very satisfied and created a heavy rain that put out the fire.

They saved hundreds and thousands of lives and billions of trees in that forest.

 

 

 

 

 

Planning for force majeure and contingent conditions.

 

Every family should have at least one Rocket Math Heater in their house or keep one in a shed for emergency use in some circumstances, such as you can not get electricity, petrol and firewood logs somehow! Rocket Math Heater can still help you and your family survive during that force majeure and contingent conditions. 

"We look after nature, she'll look after us, in this century we are beginning to realize that, in order to survive, we must protect it. The Rocket Math Heater really is an amazing asset for you and your family" 

 

We can save billions of trees

Our goal is 35,000 backers, maybe this is another daydream but we stay positive. Once we succeed in our campaign, we will choose local manufacturers to produce the Rocket Math Heater’s series to encourage some big brands of heater companies to lead the market and change our heating methods with Rocket Math Heater to save billions of trees.

We are just like that cockatoo and you are our angels, we believe thousands of cockatoos and angels together can make a dream come true. We need your help to help our beautiful planet. Trees play a very important role in global warming solutions. You can save billions of trees in one click of a button. Order here to join us engage with our global family as Rocket Math Heater fans to support our beautiful planet. We need your help to help our beautiful planet.

The world's most valuable gift for the person you love the most.

The Rocket Math Heater last for decades.

 The Rocket Math Heater can save money from firewood consumption every year.

 The Rocket Math Heater can save millions to billions of trees for the usage of wood fuel.

Only when we start to protect nature, we can then survive.

Order now you won't be disappointed, Rocket Math Heater really is an amazing asset for you and the person you love the most. 

Rocket Math Heater

The biggest innovation in the wood heater in 200 years

Techniques as simple as a rocket stove, but much more powerful than rocket stove.

 

         

 

How does it work?

There are only three simple steps to make your home cozy and then you can enjoy your relaxing lifestyle.

 

Step One

 

First load: load the firewood into the main combustion firebox.

 

 

 

 

 

It can reach very high temperatures within 10 minutes.

 

 

 

 

Step Two

 

Second load: load the firewood into the auxiliary feed tube.

 

 

 

 

It creates a rocket jet fire from those sticks.

This incoming air flows into the feed tube and across the burning wood, creating the same effect as pointing a big air-blower at your fire. It gets really hot while the wood burns beautifully, and you can hear the air roaring as it charges through the system.

 

The combustion area only burns the bottom of the feed tubes and as the wood burns vertically, only a small portion of wood is burnt at a time.

This is why we can save millions, potentially billions of trees every years. 

 

 

Step Three

These pieces of firewood are the only pieces you will need for the second load and it lasts for 4 hours.

Load two long pieces in auxiliary feed tube and three short pieces in the main firebox.

 

 

 

 

 

Now enjoy your cozy and relaxing lifestyle.

 

 

 

 

Risk & Challenges

Although this is our first time to participate in the Indiegogo campaign, we have enough confidence. the product design is straight forward and production is no stranger to us. We believe that our experienced team can well mitigate all potential risks in this journey. 

When do we start shipping?

Estimated delivery of our first products will be shipped from our local factory in October 2019.

Do you offer Warranty ? 

Yes, we offer 10 years Limited warranty against factory defects. 

How much does shipping cost?

Shipping is set to $320 to $360 due to the fact that we ship from a local factories in Australia and in the USA. It is also one of the reasons why we keep our prices so competitive, as there are no intermediaries between you and the factory.

NB: Application of extra shipping costs:  if you are in a “difficult to ship area”, such as remote locations, extra shipping costs may be applied. Please also note that some destinations, such as remote islands, can prove simply impossible to ship to. If you think you live in a hard-to-reach location, then please contact us before placing your order.

Why is my wood heater spec’d with a component that differs from that listed on your site?

The Rocket Math Heater is still in its prototype stage, so some components are subject to change if we find better, more suitable replacements. Once past this stage, we will continue to reserve the right to switch components for ones equal or higher in value. The purpose of this is to ensure that the customer continues to get the best value wood heater for the price. 

 

Why does the new design make a big difference?

They offer gravity feed without electricity.

They only burn a portion of wood, so is highly efficient.

They give no need to cut entire trees down for wood fuel.

Human beings changing heating methods will save billions of trees.

 

Why is it the same size of a heater but Rocket Math Heater is a little bit more expensive?

The new design of wood heaters need new test reports and two auxiliaries cost extra materials, the decor cover for those two auxiliaries to make sure the Rocket Math Heater is a piece of art in your house. On the other hand you get money back from firewood consumption when you use the heater.

 

Why do we need 35,000 backer for our goal?

We need to lead the future market to prevent environmental impacts from cutting trees, or the market will keep the same heating method for many years until it is too late to realize why we haven’t changed it straight away years ago?

 

What is our plan?

After this campaign we would like to license as much as possible to all the manufactures to produce these kind of models. We would like to replace old heating methods and to prevent cutting millions of trees down. 

 

Does the Rocket Math Heater only use medium sizes of timber for fuel?

Actually the Rocket Math Heater is a multi-functional wood heater, an all in one wood heater including conventional wood heater, rocket stove, rocket mass heater, wood pellet heater and more. That means you can use multiple sizes of timber for the Rocket Math Heater.

 

 

Additional questions? 
Contact us at hello@orroro.com
